original:
When you do something other than moving or communicating, you typically take an action. The Action table lists the game’s main actions, which are defined in more detail in the rules glossary.

Actions

Action

Summary

&Reference[Attack]

Attack with a weapon or an Unarmed Strike.

&Reference[Dash]

For the rest of the turn, give yourself extra movement equal to your Speed.

&Reference[Disengage]

Your movement doesn’t provoke Opportunity Attacks for the rest of the turn.

&Reference[Dodge]

Until the start of your next turn, attack rolls against you have Disadvantage, and you make Dexterity saving throws with Advantage. You lose this benefit if you have the Incapacitated condition or if your Speed is 0.

&Reference[Help]

Help another creature’s ability check or attack roll, or administer first aid.

&Reference[Hide]

Make a Dexterity (Stealth) check.

&Reference[Influence]

Make a Charisma (Deception, Intimidation, Performance, or Persuasion) or Wisdom (Animal Handling) check to alter a creature’s attitude.

&Reference[Magic]

Cast a spell, use a magic item, or use a magical feature.

&Reference[Ready]

Prepare to take an action in response to a trigger you define.

&Reference[Search]

Make a Wisdom (Insight, Medicine, Perception, or Survival) check.

&Reference[Study]

Make an Intelligence (Arcana, History, Investigation, Nature, or Religion) check.

&Reference[Utilize]

Use a nonmagical object.

Player characters and monsters can also do things not covered by these actions. Many class features and other abilities provide additional action options, and you can improvise other actions. When you describe an action not detailed elsewhere in the rules, the Dungeon Master tells you whether that action is possible and what kind of &Reference[D20 Test] you need to make, if any.
translation:
当你进行移动或交流之外的活动时，通常需要执行行动。动作表列出了游戏中的主要动作，并在规则术语表中有更详细的定义。

动作

动作

摘要

&Reference[Attack]

使用武器或进行徒手打击。

&Reference[Dash]

本回合剩余时间内，给自己增加等于你速度的额外移动力。

&Reference[Disengage]

本回合剩余时间内，你的移动不会引发借机攻击。

&Reference[Dodge]

直到你的下一个回合开始，对你的攻击检定有劣势，你在进行敏捷豁免检定时有优势。如果你处于失能状态或你的速度为0，你将失去这些增益。

&Reference[Help]

协助另一个生物的属性检定或攻击检定，或提供急救。

&Reference[Hide]

进行敏捷（隐匿）检定。

&Reference[Influence]

进行魅力（欺瞒、威吓、表演或说服） 或感知（驯兽）检定，以改变生物的态度。

&Reference[Magic]

施展法术，使用魔法物品，或使用魔法特性。

&Reference[Ready]

准备根据你定义的触发条件执行动作。

&Reference[Search]

进行感知（洞悉、医药、察觉或求生） 检定。

&Reference[Study]

进行智力（奥秘、历史、调查、自然或宗教）检定。

&Reference[Utilize]

使用非魔法物品。

玩家角色和怪物也可以进行这些动作之外的事情。许多职业特性和其他能力提供额外的动作选项，你也可以即兴进行其他动作。当你描述一个在规则中没有详细说明的动作时，DM会告诉你这个动作是否可能，以及是否需要进行任何 &Reference[D20 Test] 检定。

original:
The game uses actions to govern how much you can do at one time. You can take only one action at a time. This principle is most important in combat, as explained in @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbCombat0000000]{Combat} later in this chapter.

Actions can come up in other situations, too: in a social interaction, you can try to &Reference[Influence] a creature or use the &Reference[Search] action to read the creature’s body language, but you can’t do both at the same time. And when you’re exploring a dungeon, you can’t simultaneously use the Search action to look for traps and use the &Reference[Help] action to aid another character who’s trying to open a stuck door (with the &Reference[Utilize] action).
translation:
游戏使用动作来管理你一次能做多少事情。你在同一时刻只能执行一个行动。这个原则在战斗中尤为重要，如本章后面的 @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbCombat0000000] 部分所解释的。

动作也可能出现在其他情况下：在社交互动中， 你可以尝试 &Reference[Influence] 一个生物或使用 &Reference[Search] 动作来解读生物的肢体语言，但你不能同时做这两件事。当你探索地下城时，你不能一边使用搜索动作寻找陷阱，一边 &Reference[Help] 另一名角色 (正在进行 &Reference[Utilize] 动作) 来试图打开一扇卡住的门。

original:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbAppendixDRule.JournalEntryPage.2VqLyxMyMxgXe2wC inline]

What Would Your Character Do?

Ask yourself as you play, “What would my character do?” Playing a role involves some amount of getting into another person’s head and understanding what motivates them and how those motivations translate into action. In D&D, those actions unfold against the backdrop of a fantastic world full of situations we can only imagine. How does your character react to those situations?

This advice comes with one important caveat: avoid character choices that ruin the fun of the other players and the DM. Choose actions that delight you and your friends.
translation:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbAppendixDRule.JournalEntryPage.2VqLyxMyMxgXe2wC inline]

你的角色会做什么？

当你玩角色扮演游戏时，要问自己：“我的角色会做什么？”扮演一个角色涉及到一定程度的进入另一个人的头脑，并理解是什么驱使他们，以及这些动机如何转化为行动。在D&D中，这些行动是以一个奇幻世界为背景展开的，我们唯一能做的就是去想象。你的角色如何对这些情境作出反应？

这条建议有一个重要的警告：请不要让角色的选择破坏其他玩家和DM的乐趣。选择那些让你和你的朋友们高兴的行动。

key: entries->Art Handouts->pages->The Planes of the Multiverse->name
entries->Art Handouts->pages->The Planes of the Multiverse->src

original:
This appendix provides an overview of the multiverse, the overarching reality that encompasses D&D’s countless worlds and adventures. These realms are explored in greater detail in the Dungeon Master’s Guide, along with other planes like the Far Realm, Negative Plane, and Positive Plane.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbAppArtHandout.JournalEntryPage.YTVDDaudskR5tott caption=false]
translation:
此附录概述了多元宇宙——包含D&D数不清的世界和冒险的总体现实。这些世界，以及遥远国度、正位面和负位面等，都在《地下城主指南》中进行了更详细地说明。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbAppArtHandout.JournalEntryPage.YTVDDaudskR5tott caption=false]

key: entries->Appendix A: The Multiverse->pages->The Material Realms->name
entries->Appendix A: The Multiverse->pages->The Material Realms->text
original:
The philosophical and elemental forces of reality converge to create the following planes of existence:

Material Plane. Most D&D adventures take place on the Material Plane, which holds the worlds of settings like Dragonlance, Eberron, the Forgotten Realms, and Greyhawk. There’s also room for any world your group creates. Magic and physical laws shape this plane’s diverse worlds.

Feywild. This vibrant, idealized realm brims with life and emotion, which are most intense in the realm’s Domains of Delight.

Shadowfell. This gloom-haunted realm holds grim wastelands, haunted ruins, and the infamous Domains of Dread.
translation:
现实的精神力与元素力交杂，创造了以下存在位面：

物质位面。大多数D&D冒险发生在物质位面，这里拥有作为官方战役设定而发布的世界，包如龙枪、艾伯伦、被遗忘的国度和灰鹰。这里也同样是最适合你的团队创造世界的空间。各种魔法和物理法则塑造了这个位面中形形色色的世界。

妖精荒野。 这个生机勃勃的理想之境柔光闪烁，热烈的生命和情感肆意绽放，是国度诸界中的欢乐之域。

堕影冥界。这是一个光线阴暗之地，遍布阴森荒原、灵异废墟和臭名昭著的可怖之域。

original:
The transitive planes serve as paths between planes:

Astral Plane. This endless, silvery expanse links the Material Plane and the Outer Planes. Whole civilizations have arisen in this glimmering vastness, while others navigate the magical cosmos in spelljamming vessels.

Ethereal Plane. This ghostly realm connects the Material Plane and the Inner Planes. The region where the Ethereal Plane overlaps with other planes is called the Border Ethereal, a place where creatures can glimpse visions of planes beyond.
translation:
中转位面是以下两个位面之间的道途：

星界位面。 这个广袤无垠的银色海洋连接着物质位面和外层位面。整个文明孕育在这片荧光闪烁的辽阔之境，而其他文明则驾驶着魔法船遨游于这片魔法宇宙之中。

以太位面。 这片幽灵之境连接着物质位面和内层位面。以太位面和其他位面重叠的区域被称为以太边境，也就是一些生物能够窥视到的以太位面。

key: entries->Appendix A: The Multiverse->pages->The Inner Planes->name
entries->Appendix A: The Multiverse->pages->The Inner Planes->text
original:
Elemental forces and the building blocks of reality originate from these Inner Planes:

Elemental Plane of Air. Winds blow clouds and floating islands across this boundless sky.

Elemental Plane of Earth. This maze of caverns winds through stone and untold mineral riches.

Elemental Plane of Fire. An everlasting inferno, this realm blazes with life on volcanic islands.

Elemental Plane of Water. This bottomless ocean churns with mysterious sea life.

Elemental Chaos. Here on the fringes of the Inner Planes, elemental forces clash unpredictably.

Para-Elemental Planes. In these borderlands between the Elemental Planes, elemental forces combine into realms of ash, ice, magma, and ooze.
translation:
元素力量和构建现实的基石源于这些内层位面：

气之位面。辽阔天空之上，风吹拂着云彩和浮岛。

土之位面。在无尽的岩石与矿脉之间，迷宫般的洞窟蜿蜒曲折。

火之位面。 永燃的地狱火光中，满是生机勃勃的熔岩火岛。

水之位面。 无垠海洋之中，涌动着神秘莫测的生命。

元素混沌。 内层位面最遥远的区域中，不可估量的元素之力在此相互碰撞。

次生元素位面。在元素位面之间的边境，元素力量结合形成了灰烬、冰霜、岩浆、泥浆四个位面。

key: entries->Appendix A: The Multiverse->pages->The Outer Planes->name
entries->Appendix A: The Multiverse->pages->The Outer Planes->text
original:
Realms where ideas take form and spirits spend their afterlives, the Outer Planes are the homes of immortals. The following locations compose the Outer Planes:

Sigil. Sigil, the City of Doors, is a metropolis rather than a plane at the center of the Outer Planes. Here portals lead throughout the multiverse, and the enigmatic Lady of Pain maintains order.

Outlands. Influences from the other Outer Planes converge in the Outlands, where portals lead to those planes. At the Outlands’ center rises the Spire, a pillar atop which floats Sigil.

Other Outer Planes. These planes are listed on the Outer Planes table. Some are paradises, some are nightmare realms, and some are more bizarre. Each is dominated by forces that embody one or more of the alignments described in @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbCreatingAChar.JournalEntryPage.6ThVICG0QSRy7L0F]{chapter 2}.

Outer Planes

Outer Plane

Alignment

Chaotic Evil

Acheron

Lawful Evil, Lawful Neutral

Arborea

Arcadia

Lawful Good, Lawful Neutral

Beastlands

Bytopia

Lawful Good, Neutral Good

Carceri

Chaotic Evil, Neutral Evil

Elysium

Neutral Good

Gehenna

Lawful Evil, Neutral Evil

Hades

Neutral Evil

Limbo

Chaotic Neutral

Mechanus

Lawful Neutral

Mount Celestia

Lawful Good

Nine Hells

Lawful Evil

Outlands

Neutral

Pandemonium

Ysgard

Chaotic Good, Chaotic Neutral
translation:
外层位面是众神的居所，在这里，思想得以形成，灵魂得以永生。外层位面包括以下地点：

印记城。印记城，即众门之城， 比起外层位面的中心，这里更像是一座商业城市。无数的传送门在此连通着多元宇宙，而神秘莫测的痛苦女士维持着一切的秩序。

外域。 沿着通向各地的传送门，来自其他外层位面的影响在外域汇集。外域中心耸立着无极尖峰，在这单薄的顶峰上漂浮着的便是印记城。

其他外层位面。这些位面在外层位面表中列出。有些是天堂，有些如梦魇，还有些难以名状。每一个位面都受一股强大的力量所支配。这些力量彰显着 @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbCreatingAChar.JournalEntryPage.6ThVICG0QSRy7L0F]{第 2 章} 中所述的一个或多个阵营。

外层位面

外层位面

无底深渊

世外桃源

守序善良、守序中立

万兽园

混乱善良、中立善良

双生天堂

守序善良、中立善良

卡瑟利

混乱邪恶、中立邪恶

极乐境

中立善良

焦炎炼狱

守序邪恶、中立邪恶

哈迪斯

中立邪恶

混沌海

混乱中立

机械境

守序中立

天界山

守序善良

九层地狱

守序邪恶

外域

绝对中立

喧癫空隧

约瑟园

混乱善良、混乱中立

original:
This appendix provides stat blocks for creatures mentioned elsewhere in the book, particularly in the class, equipment, and spell chapters. See the rules glossary for how to read a stat block, and see the Monster Manual for even more creatures.

The following stat blocks are presented in alphabetical order. When the Dungeon Master uses a stat block, the DM may change details in it.

original: You have the &Reference[Blinded] condition while trying to see something in a Heavily Obscured space. See also &Reference[Blinded], &Reference[Darkness], and @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbExploration00]{Exploration}.
translation: 在你正尝试去看某个处于重度遮蔽下的事物期间，你陷入 &Reference[Blinded] 状态。另见“ &Reference[Blinded]”、“ &Reference[Darkness]”，以及第 1 章（“@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbExploration00]”）。

original: Bright Light lets most creatures see normally. Even gloomy days provide Bright Light, as do torches, lanterns, fires, and other sources of illumination within a specific radius.
translation: 明亮光照明亮光照有着正常的可见度。即使是阴天也能提供明亮的光源，在特定半径内，火把、灯笼、火和其他照明源也能提供明亮的光。

original: An area with Dim Light is &Reference[Lightly Obscured]. See also @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbExploration00]{Exploration}.
translation: 处于微光光照的区域是 &Reference[Lightly Obscured]。另见第 1 章（“ @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbExploration00]”）。

original: An area of darkness is @UUID[.YkuKTIH2YaYW8lTS]{Heavily Obscured}. See also @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbExploration00]{Exploration}.

If you have Truesight, your vision is enhanced within a specified range. Within that range, your vision pierces through the following:

Darkness. You can see in normal and magical @UUID[.UY4RGoKw9rOeazur]{Darkness}.

Invisibility. You see creatures and objects that have the @UUID[.MQIZ1zRLWRcNOtPN]{Invisible} condition.

Visual Illusions. Visual illusions appear transparent to you, and you automatically succeed on saving throws against them.

Transformations. You discern the true form of any creature or object you see that has been transformed by magic.

Ethereal Plane. You see into the Ethereal Plane. See also @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbAppendixATheM.JournalEntryPage.JUMfpR65UBZvvQut]{Transitive Planes}.
translation:
若你拥有真实视觉，你在特定范围内的视觉能力将被强化。在真实视觉范围内，你的视野将可以“看破”以下这些事物：

黑暗。 你可以看穿黑暗，不论其是普通黑暗还是魔法 @UUID[.UY4RGoKw9rOeazur]。

隐形。你可以看见具有 @UUID[.MQIZ1zRLWRcNOtPN]状态的生物及物件。

视觉幻象。 你眼中的视觉幻象将变成透明的，且你自动通过于对抗这些幻象的豁免。

变化。 你能看出任何你所见的、被魔法变化为另一形态的生物/物件的真实形态。

以太位面。 你可以看到以太位面上的事物。另见附录A（“ @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbAppendixATheM.JournalEntryPage.JUMfpR65UBZvvQut]”）。

original:
Various class features, spells, and other abilities let you take an additional action on your turn called a Bonus Action. The @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.classes.Item.phbrgeCunningAct]{Cunning Action} feature, for example, allows a Rogue to take a Bonus Action. You can take a Bonus Action only when a special ability, a spell, or another feature of the game states that you can do something as a Bonus Action. You otherwise don’t have a Bonus Action to take.

You can take only one Bonus Action on your turn, so you must choose which Bonus Action to use if you have more than one available.

You choose when to take a Bonus Action during your turn unless the Bonus Action’s timing is specified. Anything that deprives you of your ability to take actions also prevents you from taking a Bonus Action.
translation:
不同的职业特性、法术和其他能力让你在你的回合中采取额外的动作，称为附赠动作。例如， @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.classes.Item.phbrgeCunningAct] 特性允许游荡者使用附赠动作。只有特殊能力、法术或游戏的其他功能允许你可以做某件事时，你才能采取附赠行动。否则你就没有附赠动作可执行。

附赠动作是一种特殊的动作，即使是执行过动作你也可以在同一回合中执行附赠动作。你无法在一个回合中执行超过一个附赠动作，而只有在有某条规则明确提及你可以执行附赠动作的情况下，你才能执行附赠动作。

original:
On your turn, you can take one action. Choose which action to take from those below or from the special actions provided by your features.

  • @UUID[.f4fZHwBvpbpzRyn4]{Attack}

  • @UUID[.6l6nBKip4LqB1sCU]{Dash}

  • @UUID[.w1AGsemFERfjqWNx]{Disengage}

  • @UUID[.3YJIuyCMmuUrfmuX]{Dodge}

  • @UUID[.5S8i59qskkd9GGcJ]{Help}

  • @UUID[.rqhOsUY4wWa1oHTy]{Hide}

  • @UUID[.4V59Q1dlWjNhpJGo]{Influence}

  • @UUID[.iIIDUsmSOkL0xNzF]{Magic}

  • @UUID[.nI9tN6Oq7fCV7hcA]{Ready}

  • @UUID[.ySj4gYZ4ADZoia7R]{Search}

  • @UUID[.Nuz0Wx4a4aAPcC34]{Study}

  • @UUID[.UDlogfdiT2uYEZz4]{Utilize}
translation:
在你的回合，你可以执行一项动作。你可以选用下列的这些动作项来执行，你也可以选用某些特性为你提供特殊动作项来执行。另见第 1 章（“动作”）。这些动作在术语汇编的其他条目中皆有释义：

  • @UUID[.f4fZHwBvpbpzRyn4]

  • @UUID[.6l6nBKip4LqB1sCU]

  • @UUID[.w1AGsemFERfjqWNx]

  • @UUID[.3YJIuyCMmuUrfmuX]

  • @UUID[.5S8i59qskkd9GGcJ]

  • @UUID[.rqhOsUY4wWa1oHTy]

  • @UUID[.4V59Q1dlWjNhpJGo]

  • @UUID[.iIIDUsmSOkL0xNzF]

  • @UUID[.nI9tN6Oq7fCV7hcA]

  • @UUID[.ySj4gYZ4ADZoia7R]

  • @UUID[.Nuz0Wx4a4aAPcC34]

  • @UUID[.UDlogfdiT2uYEZz4]

original:
When you take the Attack action, you can make one attack roll with a weapon or an Unarmed Strike.

Equipping and Unequipping Weapons. You can either equip or unequip one weapon when you make an attack as part of this action. You do so either before or after the attack. If you equip a weapon before an attack, you don't need to use it for that attack. Equipping a weapon includes drawing it from a sheath or picking it up. Unequipping a weapon includes sheathing, stowing, or dropping it.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbAppendixDRule.JournalEntryPage.JxboWb0XHo2GwqD0 inline]
translation:
当你执行攻击动作时，你可以用你的武器或徒手打击进行一次攻击检定。

装备武器与卸下武器。 作为攻击动作的一部分，每当你发动一次攻击时，你都可以装备或卸下一把武器。你可以在此次攻击之前或之后装备/卸下武器。如果你在发动一次攻击前装备一把武器，你不需要以这把武器发动这次攻击。装备武器的行为包括从鞘（或类似的收纳物）中拔出你的武器以及捡起一把武器。卸下武器的行为包括把武器收入鞘（或类似的收纳物）中、收起来以及丢下它。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbAppendixDRule.JournalEntryPage.JxboWb0XHo2GwqD0 inline]

original:
When you take the Dash action, you gain extra movement for the current turn. The increase equals your &Reference[Speed] after applying any modifiers. With a Speed of 30 feet, for example, you can move up to 60 feet on your turn if you Dash. If your Speed of 30 feet is reduced to 15 feet, you can move up to 30 feet this turn if you Dash.

If you have a special speed, such as a Fly Speed or Swim Speed, you can use that speed instead of your Speed when you take this action. You choose which speed to use each time you take it.
translation:
当你执行疾走动作时，你可以获得供当前回合使用的一些额外移动力。额外移动力的量等于你的 &Reference[Speed] （在一切调整值计算完后）。举个例子，如果你有30尺速度，而你执行了疾走动作，那么当前回合你就可以移动至多60尺距离。如果你的速度被从30尺降至15尺，那么在你执行了疾走动作的回合中你只能移动至多30尺。

如果你拥有特殊速度（例如飞行速度或游泳速度），你可以使用该速度代替你的速度来执行疾走动作。每次你执行疾走动作时你都需要选择具体使用哪个速度。

original: If you take the Disengage action, your movement doesn’t provoke &Reference[Opportunity Attacks] for the rest of the current turn.
translation: 执行撤离动作后，当前回合的剩余时间内，你的移动不会引发 &Reference[Opportunity Attacks] 。

original:
If you take the Dodge action, you gain the following benefits: until the start of your next turn, any attack roll made against you has &Reference[Disadvantage] if you can see the attacker, and you make Dexterity saving throws with &Reference[Advantage].

You lose these benefits if you have the Incapacitated condition or if your Speed is 0.
translation:
执行回避动作时，你将获得以下增益：直至你的下个回合开始，任何以你为目标的攻击检定具有 &Reference[Disadvantage] ，除非你看不见攻击者，且你进行的敏捷豁免检定具有 &Reference[Advantage]。

如果你陷入 &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] 或你的速度降至了0，你会失去这些增益。

original:
When you take the Help action, you do one of the following.

Assist an Ability Check. Choose one of your skill or tool proficiencies and one ally who is near enough for you to assist verbally or physically when they make an ability check. That ally has &Reference[Advantage] on the next ability check they make with the chosen skill or tool. This benefit expires if the ally doesn’t use it before the start of your next turn. The DM has final say on whether your assistance is possible.

Assist an Attack Roll. You momentarily distract an enemy within 5 feet of you, giving Advantage to the next attack roll by one of your allies against that enemy. This benefit expires at the start of your next turn.
translation:
当你执行协助动作时，你可以做到以下两种效果之一。

辅助一次属性检定。 选择一项你的技能熟练或工具熟练，并选择一个与你之间距离不远，至少你足以口头/物理上辅助的盟友。那个盟友下一次使用你所选择的技能/工具进行的属性检定具有&Reference[Advantage] 。在你的下个回合开始前，若该盟友仍未使用掉这一辅助效果，辅助效果会消失。DM拥有你是否可以辅助的最终解释权。

辅助一次攻击检定。 你迅速地虚晃位于你5尺内的一个敌人，令下一次由你的某名盟友对该敌人进行的攻击检定具有优势。这一辅助效果会在你的下个回合开始时消失。

original:
With the Influence action, you urge a monster to do something. Describe or roleplay how you’re communicating with the monster. Are you trying to deceive, intimidate, amuse, or gently persuade? The DM then determines whether the monster feels willing, unwilling, or hesitant due to your interaction; this determination establishes whether an ability check is necessary, as explained below.

Willing. If your urging aligns with the monster’s desires, no ability check is necessary; the monster fulfills your request in a way it prefers.

Unwilling. If your urging is repugnant to the monster or counter to its alignment, no ability check is necessary; it doesn’t comply.

Hesitant. If you urge the monster to do something that it is hesitant to do, you must make an ability check, which is affected by the monster’s attitude: Indifferent, Friendly, or Hostile, each of which is defined in this glossary. The Influence Checks table suggests which ability check to make based on how you’re interacting with the monster. The DM chooses the check, which has a default DC equal to 15 or the monster’s Intelligence score, whichever is higher. On a successful check, the monster does as urged. On a failed check, you must wait 24 hours (or a duration set by the DM) before urging it in the same way again.

Influence Checks

Ability Check

Interaction

[[/check dec]]

Deceiving a monster that understands you

[[/check itm]]

Intimidating a monster

[[/check prf]]

Amusing a monster

[[/check per]]

Persuading a monster that understands you

[[/check ani]]

Gently coaxing a Beast or Monstrosity
translation:
借由影响动作，你尝试要求一个怪物去做些什么事。请描述或扮演出你与怪物之间是如何交流的。你是在欺骗它？恐吓它？取悦它？还是和蔼地说服它？然后，根据你与怪物的互动，由DM来决定这怪物愿意、不愿意还是犹豫不决，这三种情况将决定你是否需要进行属性检定，具体如下所述。

愿意。 如果你要求的方向与该怪物的欲求一致，那么你不需要进行属性检定，而怪物会以它偏好的方式去完成你的要求。

不愿意。 如果你的要求对于怪物来说是无法接受的，或者有悖于其阵营，那么你也不需要进行属性检定，因为它不会同意的。

犹豫不决。 如果怪物对于你要求去做的事情有些犹豫，你必须进行一次属性检定。此次检定会受到怪物的态度（冷漠、友好、敌对）影响，这些态度均在术语汇编中有所定义。影响检定表上基于你与怪物的互动方式，建议了所需进行的属性检定，但具体的检定类型由DM来选择。检定的DC默认为15或怪物的智力属性值，两者取高者。检定成功时，怪物会按你要求的去做。检定失败时，你必须等待24小时（或者DM设定的一段时间）后才能再次以影响动作向它要求。

影响检定

属性检定

互动方式

[[/check dec]]

欺骗一个可以理解你的怪物

[[/check itm]]

恐吓一个怪物

[[/check prf]]

取悦一个怪物

[[/check per]]

说服一个可以理解你的怪物

[[/check ani]]

和蔼地劝诱一只野兽或怪兽

original:
When you take the Magic action, you cast a spell that has a casting time of an action or use a feature or magic item that requires a Magic action to be activated.

If you cast a spell that has a casting time of 1 minute or longer, you must take the Magic action on each turn of that casting, and you must maintain &Reference[Concentration] while you do so. If your Concentration is broken, the spell fails, but you don’t expend a spell slot.
translation:
你可以执行预备动作来等待某个特定事件到来，再进行你的行动。为此，你需要在自己回合中执行预备动作，使你可以在自己的下个回合开始前执行一项反应。

\n

若你需要施展一道施法时间为1分钟以上的法术，你必须在施展该法术期间的每个回合中都执行魔法动作，且你必须为其保持 @UUID[.0a2umg2mJMAzM9Q3]{专注} 。若你的专注被打断，法术将施展失败，但你不会因此消耗法术位。

original:
You take the Ready action to wait for a particular circumstance before you act. To do so, you take this action on your turn, which lets you act by taking a @UUID[.OhSIWaQ61dOp7S8M]{Reaction} before the start of your next turn.

First, you decide what perceivable circumstance will trigger your Reaction. Then, you choose the action you will take in response to that trigger, or you choose to move up to your Speed in response to it. Examples include “If the cultist steps on the trapdoor, I’ll pull the lever that opens it,” and “If the zombie steps next to me, I move away.”

When the trigger occurs, you can either take your Reaction right after the trigger finishes or ignore the trigger.

When you Ready a spell, you cast it as normal (expending any resources used to cast it) but hold its energy, which you release with your Reaction when the trigger occurs. To be readied, a spell must have a casting time of an action, and holding on to the spell’s magic requires @UUID[.0a2umg2mJMAzM9Q3]{Concentration}, which you can maintain up to the start of your next turn. If your Concentration is broken, the spell dissipates without taking effect.
translation:
你可以执行预备动作来等待某个特定事件到来，再进行你的行动。为此，你需要在自己回合中执行预备动作，使你可以在自己的下个回合开始前执行一项 @UUID[.OhSIWaQ61dOp7S8M]。

首先，你需要设定“何种可感知的事件能触发你的反应”。然后，作为你对该事件的响应，你选择你当时要执行的动作或是选择移动等于你速度的距离。举个例子，你可以设定“当那个邪教徒踩上了活板门时，我就拉下打开活板门的拉杆”或是“当那个僵尸走到我身旁时，我就跑开”。

当触发事件发生时，你可以选择在触发事件完成后紧跟着执行你设定的响应动作或是选择无视该触发事件。

当你预备一道法术时，你需要如常施展它（消耗如常施展它所需的各种资源）来维持其能量，并在触发事件发生时用你的反应去释放它。为预备一道法术，这道法术的施法时间必须是动作，且你在维持法术魔法能量期间必须为其保持 @UUID[.0a2umg2mJMAzM9Q3]{专注}（此专注至多持续至你的下个回合开始时）。如果你的专注被打断，法术将消散，且不会产生任何效应。

original:
When you take the Search action, you make a Wisdom check to discern something that isn’t obvious. The Search table suggests which skills are applicable when you take this action, depending on what you’re trying to detect.

Search

Skill

Thing to Detect

Insight

Creature’s state of mind

Medicine

Creature’s ailment or cause of death

Perception

Concealed creature or object

Survival

Tracks or food
translation:
当你执行搜索动作，你进行一次感知检定来搜索某个“并不显眼”的东西。根据你尝试搜索的具体内容，搜索表提供了你在执行此动作时可用技能的建议。

搜索

技能

要搜索的东西

洞悉

生物的心理状态

医药

生物的伤势，或是死因

察觉

被藏匿的生物/物件

生存

踪迹，或是食物

original:
When you take the Study action, you make an Intelligence check to study your memory, a book, a clue, or another source of knowledge and call to mind an important piece of information about it.

The Areas of Knowledge table suggests which skills are applicable to various areas of knowledge.

Areas of Knowledge

Skill

Areas

Arcana

Spells, magic items, eldritch symbols, magical traditions, planes of existence, and certain creatures (Aberrations, Constructs, Elementals, Fey, and Monstrosities)

History

Historic events and people, ancient civilizations, wars, and certain creatures (Giants and Humanoids)

Investigation

Traps, ciphers, riddles, and gadgetry

Nature

Terrain, flora, weather, and certain creatures (Beasts, Dragons, Oozes, and Plants)

Religion

Deities, religious hierarchies and rites, holy symbols, cults, and certain creatures (Celestials, Fiends, and Undead)
translation:
当你执行研究动作时，你进行一次智力检定来研究你的记忆、一本书、一条线索或是其他来源的知识，并回忆起有关这一事物的重要信息。

知识范围表基于智力检定相关的知识范围，给予了适用何种技能的建议。

知识范围

技能

范围

奥秘

法术、魔法物品、魔能符号、魔法传承、存在位面、特定生物（异怪、构装、元素、妖精、怪兽）

历史

事件和历史人物、古文明、战争、特定生物（巨人、类人）

调查

陷阱、密文、谜语、设备

自然

地形、植物、天气、特定生物（野兽、龙类、泥怪、植物）

宗教

神祇、宗教层级和仪式、圣徽、教团、特定生物（天界、邪魔、亡灵）

original: You normally interact with an object while doing something else, such as when you draw a sword as part of the @UUID[.f4fZHwBvpbpzRyn4]{Attack} action. When an object requires an action for its use, you take the Utilize action.
translation: 通常，你会在做其他事的同时与一件物品进行交互，例如作为 @UUID[.f4fZHwBvpbpzRyn4]动作的一部分来拔出一把剑。当一个物件需要一个动作才能使用时，你需要为其执行操作动作。

original:
With the Hide action, you try to conceal yourself. To do so, you must succeed on a [[/check stealth dc=15]] check while you’re @UUID[.YkuKTIH2YaYW8lTS]{Heavily Obscured} or behind &Reference[Three-Quarters Cover] or &Reference[Total Cover], and you must be out of any enemy’s line of sight; if you can see a creature, you can discern whether it can see you.

On a successful check, you have the &Reference[Invisible] condition. Make note of your check’s total, which is the DC for a creature to find you with a [[/check prc]] check.

The condition ends on you immediately after any of the following occurs: you make a sound louder than a whisper, an enemy finds you, you make an attack roll, or you cast a spell with a Verbal component.
translation:
执行躲藏动作时，你尝试将自己隐蔽起来。为了执行躲藏，你必须通过一次 [[/check stealth dc=15]] 检定，你只有身处 @UUID[.YkuKTIH2YaYW8lTS] 之中、处于 &Reference[Three-Quarters Cover] 或处于 &Reference[Total Cover] 时才能这么做。此外，你也必须不在任何敌人的视野内（如果你能看到一个生物，你就可以判断它是否能够看见你）。

如果检定成功，你获得 &Reference[Invisible] 。记下你的检定结果总值，这将成为其他生物通过一个 [[/check prc]] 检定来找到你的DC。

发生以下情况时，你的隐形状态会立刻结束：你发出了高于低语的响声；敌人找到了你；你进行了一次攻击检定；你施展了一个带有语言成分的法术。

original:
A condition is a temporary game state. The definition of a condition says how it affects its recipient, and various rules define how to end a condition. This glossary defines these conditions:

  • @UUID[.uDogReMO6QtH6NDw]{Blinded}
  • @UUID[.vLAsIUa0FhZNsyLk]{Charmed}
  • @UUID[.qlRw66tJhk0zLnwq]{Deafened}
  • @UUID[.jSQtPgNm0i4f3Qi3]{Exhaustion}
  • @UUID[.93uaingTESo8N1qL]{Frightened}
  • @UUID[.KbQ1k0OIowtZeQgp]{Grappled}
  • @UUID[.4i3G895hy99piand]{Incapacitated}
  • @UUID[.MQIZ1zRLWRcNOtPN]{Invisible}
  • @UUID[.RnxZoTglPnLc6UPb]{Paralyzed}
  • @UUID[.6vtLuQT9lwZ9N299]{Petrified}
  • @UUID[.HWs8kEojffqwTSJz]{Poisoned}
  • @UUID[.QxCrRcgMdUd3gfzz]{Prone}
  • @UUID[.dqLeGdpHtb8FfcxX]{Restrained}
  • @UUID[.EjbXjvyQAMlDyANI]{Stunned}
  • @UUID[.fZCRaKEJd4KoQCqH]{Unconscious}

A condition doesn’t stack with itself; a recipient either has a condition or doesn’t. The &Reference[Exhaustion] condition is an exception to that rule. See also chapter 1 @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbConditions000.JournalEntryPage.BuIBCfux6QYAah3q]{Conditions}.
translation:
状态是一种临时的游戏状况。每个状态的释义中都会解释它给其受状态者带来何样的影响，且有一系列有关如何结束这些状态的规则。这些状态在术语汇编的其他条目中皆有释义：

  • @UUID[.uDogReMO6QtH6NDw]
  • @UUID[.vLAsIUa0FhZNsyLk]
  • @UUID[.jSQtPgNm0i4f3Qi3]
  • @UUID[.jSQtPgNm0i4f3Qi3]
  • @UUID[.93uaingTESo8N1qL]
  • @UUID[.KbQ1k0OIowtZeQgp]
  • @UUID[.4i3G895hy99piand]
  • @UUID[.MQIZ1zRLWRcNOtPN]
  • @UUID[.RnxZoTglPnLc6UPb]
  • @UUID[.6vtLuQT9lwZ9N299]
  • @UUID[.HWs8kEojffqwTSJz]
  • @UUID[.QxCrRcgMdUd3gfzz]
  • @UUID[.dqLeGdpHtb8FfcxX]
  • @UUID[.EjbXjvyQAMlDyANI]
  • @UUID[.fZCRaKEJd4KoQCqH]

状态不会与自己叠加——一个生物只有“有这个状态”与“没有这个状态”两种状况。不过&Reference[Exhaustion] 状态是此规则的一个例外。另见第 1 章 “@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbConditions000.JournalEntryPage.BuIBCfux6QYAah3q]{状态}".

original:
Can’t See. You can’t see and automatically fail any ability check that requires sight.

Attacks Affected. Attack rolls against you have Advantage, and your attack rolls have &Reference[Disadvantage].
translation:
看不见 Can't See 你无法视物，且会自动失败于任何需要视觉的属性检定。

攻击影响 Attacks Affected 以你为目标的攻击检定具有优势，而你进行的攻击检定具有劣势。

original:
While you have the Charmed condition, you experience the following effects.

Can’t Harm the Charmer. You can’t attack the charmer or target the charmer with damaging abilities or magical effects.

Social Advantage. The charmer has Advantage on any ability check to interact with you socially.
translation:
魅惑状态期间，你将遭受以下这些效应。

无法伤害魅惑源 你无法攻击魅惑源，也无法将其作为伤害性能力或魔法效应的对象。

社交优势 Social Advantage 魅惑源对你进行的任何有关社交的属性检定均具有优势。

original: Can’t Hear. You can’t hear and automatically fail any ability check that requires hearing.
translation: 听不见 Can't Hear 你无法听声，且会自动失败于任何依赖听觉的属性检定。

original:
While you have the Exhaustion condition, you experience the following effects.

Exhaustion Levels. This condition is cumulative. Each time you receive it, you gain 1 Exhaustion level. You die if your Exhaustion level is 6.

D20 Tests Affected. When you make a &Reference[D20 Test], the roll is reduced by 2 times your Exhaustion level.

Speed Reduced. Your &Reference[Speed] is reduced by a number of feet equal to 5 times your Exhaustion level.

Removing Exhaustion Levels. Finishing a &Reference[Long Rest] removes 1 of your Exhaustion levels. When your Exhaustion level reaches 0, the condition ends.
translation:
力竭状态期间，你将遭受以下这些效应。

力竭等级 Exhaustion Levels 此状态可叠加。每次你获得此状态，力竭等级都增加1层。当你力竭等级累加到6级你将死亡。

D20检定影响 D20 Tests Affected 当你进行一次D20检定时，此次检定将减去你力竭等级2倍的值。

速度降低 Speed Reduced 你的速度减少等于你力竭等级5倍尺。

移除力竭等级 Removing Exhaustion Levels 完成一次长休时，你的力竭等级减少1层。当你力竭等级降至0时，此状态结束。

original:
While you have the Frightened condition, you experience the following effects.

Ability Checks and Attacks Affected. You have &Reference[Disadvantage] on ability checks and attack rolls while the source of fear is within line of sight.

Can’t Approach. You can’t willingly move closer to the source of fear.
translation:
恐慌状态期间，你将遭受以下这些效应。

属性检定与攻击影响 Ability Checks and Attacks Affected 只要恐惧源在你的视线范围内，你进行的属性检定与攻击检定就具有劣势。

无法靠近 Can't Approach 你无法自愿地向靠近恐惧源的方向移动。

original:
While you have the Grappled condition, you experience the following effects.

Speed 0. Your Speed is 0 and can’t increase.

Attacks Affected. You have &Reference[Disadvantage] on attack rolls against any target other than the grappler.

Movable. The grappler can drag or carry you when it moves, but every foot of movement costs it 1 extra foot unless you are Tiny or two or more sizes smaller than it.
translation:
受擒状态期间，你将遭受以下这些效应。

速度归零 Speed 0。 你的速度为0，且无法被增加。

攻击影响 Attacks Affected 除擒抱者外，你对其他任何目标进行的攻击检定都具有劣势。

带动Movable 擒抱者移动时，其可以拖拽或承载你，但其每移动1尺都需要为此额外消耗1尺移动力。若你的体型为微型或你的体型小于擒抱者两级以上，擒抱者拖拽/承载你将不需要额外消耗移动力。

original:
While you have the &Reference[incapacitated] condition, you experience the following effects.

Inactive. You can’t take any @UUID[.SsIXfzS2ZttwAaKj]{action}, @UUID[.EjR3KL7KLTwjWBS0]{Bonus Action}, or @UUID[.OhSIWaQ61dOp7S8M]{Reaction}.

No Concentration. Your @UUID[.0a2umg2mJMAzM9Q3]{Concentration} is broken.

Speechless. You can’t speak.

Surprised. If you’re Incapacitated when you roll Initiative, you have &Reference[Disadvantage] on the roll.
translation:
失能状态期间，你将遭受以下这些效应。

无法行动 Inactive 你无法执行任何 @UUID[.SsIXfzS2ZttwAaKj]{动作}、@UUID[.EjR3KL7KLTwjWBS0]{附赠动作}以及@UUID[.OhSIWaQ61dOp7S8M]{反应}。

无法专注 No Concentration 你的@UUID[.0a2umg2mJMAzM9Q3]{专注}被破坏

无法说话 Speechless 你无法说话。

措手不及 Surprised 如果你在陷入失能状态期间投掷先攻，你的先攻检定将具有劣势。

original:
While you have the Invisible condition, you experience the following effects.

Surprise. If you’re Invisible when you roll Initiative, you have &Reference[Advantage] on the roll.

Concealed. You aren’t affected by any effect that requires its target to be seen unless the effect’s creator can somehow see you. Any equipment you are wearing or carrying is also concealed.

Attacks Affected. Attack rolls against you have &Reference[Disadvantage], and your attack rolls have Advantage. If a creature can somehow see you, you don’t gain this benefit against that creature.
translation:
隐形状态期间，你将获得以下这些效应。

出其不意Surprise 如果你在投掷先攻时处于隐形状态，你的先攻检定将具有优势。

隐蔽 Concealed 任何需要能够看见目标的效应都不会影响到你，除非效应的源头能通过某种方式看到你。你所着装或携带的一切装备也同样会被隐蔽起来。

攻击影响 Attacks Affected。 以你为目标的攻击检定具有劣势，而你进行的攻击检定具有优势。如果一个生物能以某种方式看见你，那么你在面对该生物时不会获得这一增益。

original:
While you have the Paralyzed condition, you experience the following effects.

Incapacitated. You have the &Reference[Incapacitated] condition.

Speed 0. Your Speed is 0 and can’t increase.

Saving Throws Affected. You automatically fail Strength and Dexterity saving throws.

Attacks Affected. Attack rolls against you have &Reference[Advantage].

Automatic Critical Hits. Any attack roll that hits you is a Critical Hit if the attacker is within 5 feet of you.
translation:
麻痹状态期间，你将遭受以下这些效应。

失能 Incapacitated。 你陷入失能状态。

速度归零 Speed 0 你的速度为0，且无法被增加。

豁免影响 Saving Throws Affected 你自动失败于力量豁免检定与敏捷豁免检定。

攻击影响 Attacks Affected 以你为目标的攻击检定具有优势。

自动重击 Automatic Critical Hits 若攻击者位于你5尺内，其任何命中你的攻击检定都会变为重击。

original:
While you have the Petrified condition, you experience the following effects.

Turned to Inanimate Substance. You are transformed, along with any nonmagical objects you are wearing and carrying, into a solid inanimate substance (usually stone). Your weight increases by a factor of ten, and you cease aging.

Incapacitated. You have the &Reference[Incapacitated] condition.

Speed 0. Your Speed is 0 and can’t increase.

Attacks Affected. Attack rolls against you have &Reference[Advantage].

Saving Throws Affected. You automatically fail Strength and Dexterity saving throws.

Resist Damage. You have &Reference[Resistance] to all damage.

Poison Immunity. You have Immunity to the &Reference[Poisoned] condition.
translation:
石化状态期间，你将遭受以下这些效应。

化为非活动材质 Turned to Inanimate Substance 你与你穿着或携带的所有非魔法物品将被变化为坚固的、非活动的材质（通常是石头）。你的重量变为原本的十倍，且你将停止老化。

失能 Incapacitated 你陷入失能状态。

速度归零 Speed 0 你的速度为0，且无法被增加。

攻击影响 Attacks Affected 以你为目标的攻击检定具有优势。

豁免影响 Saving Affected 你自动失败于力量豁免检定与敏捷豁免检定。

伤害全抗 Resist Damage 你具有所有伤害的抗性。

中毒免疫 Poison Immunity 你具有中毒状态的免疫。

original:
While you have the Poisoned condition, you experience the following effect.

Ability Checks and Attacks Affected. You have &Reference[Disadvantage] on attack rolls and ability checks.
translation:
中毒状态期间，你将遭受以下这个效应。

属性检定与攻击影响 Ability Checks and Attacks Affected 你进行的攻击检定与属性检定具有劣势。

original:
While you have the Prone condition, you experience the following effects.

Restricted Movement. Your only movement options are to crawl or to spend an amount of movement equal to half your &Reference[Speed] (round down) to right yourself and thereby end the condition. If your Speed is 0, you can’t right yourself.

Attacks Affected. You have &Reference[Disadvantage] on attack rolls. An attack roll against you has &Reference[Advantage] if the attacker is within 5 feet of you. Otherwise, that attack roll has Disadvantage.
translation:
倒地状态期间，你将遭受以下这些效应。

阻碍移动 Restricted Movement 你唯二的移动选项是匍匐移动或是消耗你速度一半数值（向下取整）的移动力起立，并由此终止这一状态。如果你的速度为0，你无法起立。

攻击影响 Attacks Affected 你进行的攻击检定具有劣势。若攻击者位于你5尺内，其以你为目标的攻击检定具有优势；若攻击者不位于你5尺内，其以你为目标的攻击检定具有劣势。

original:
While you have the Restrained condition, you experience the following effects.

Speed 0. Your &Reference[Speed] is 0 and can’t increase.

Attacks Affected. Attack rolls against you have Advantage, and your attack rolls have &Reference[Disadvantage].

Saving Throws Affected. You have Disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.
translation:
束缚状态期间，你将遭受以下这些效应。

速度归零 Speed 0 你的速度为0，且无法被增加。

攻击影响 Attacks Affected 以你为目标的攻击检定具有优势，而你进行的攻击检定具有劣势。

豁免影响 Saving Affected 你进行的敏捷豁免检定具有劣势。

original:
When you have the Stunned condition, you experience the following effects.

Incapacitated. You have the @UUID[.4i3G895hy99piand]{Incapacitated} condition.

Saving Throws Affected. You automatically fail Strength and Dexterity saving throws.

Attacks Affected. Attack rolls against you have &Reference[Advantage].
translation:
震慑状态期间，你将遭受以下这些效应。

失能 Incapacitated 你陷入@UUID[.4i3G895hy99piand]{失能}状态。

豁免影响 Saving Throws Affected 你自动失败于力量豁免检定与敏捷豁免检定。

攻击影响 Attacks Affected 以你为目标的攻击检定具有优势。

original:
While you have the Unconscious condition, you experience the following effects.

Inert. You have the &Reference[Incapacitated] and &Reference[Prone] conditions, and you drop whatever you’re holding. When this condition ends, you remain Prone.

Speed 0. Your &Reference[Speed] is 0 and can’t increase.

Attacks Affected. Attack rolls against you have &Reference[Advantage].

Saving Throws Affected. You automatically fail Strength and Dexterity saving throws.

Automatic Critical Hits. Any attack roll that hits you is a Critical Hit if the attacker is within 5 feet of you.
translation:
昏迷状态期间，你将遭受以下这些效应。

迟钝 Inert 你陷入失能状态与倒地状态，你手上持握的东西也会全数掉落。此状态结束时，倒地状态并不会因此结束。

速度归零 Speed 0你的速度为0，且无法被增加。

攻击影响 Attacks Affected 以你为目标的攻击检定具有优势。

豁免影响 Saving Throws Affected 你自动失败于力量豁免检定与敏捷豁免检定。

自动重击 Automatic Critical Hits 若攻击者位于你5尺内，其任何命中你的攻击检定都会变为重击。

original: A hazard is an environmental danger. See also @UUID[.mPBGM1vguT5IPzxT]{Burning}, @UUID[.FZFvLNOX0lHaHZ1k]{Dehydration}, @UUID[.lCwPWK4ODxw2IV1x]{Falling}, @UUID[.earBo4vQPC1ti4g7]{Malnutrition}, and @UUID[.gAvV8TLyS8UGq00x]{Suffocation}.
translation: 危害是一种与环境有关的危险。另见“ @UUID[.mPBGM1vguT5IPzxT]”、“@UUID[.FZFvLNOX0lHaHZ1k], @UUID[.lCwPWK4ODxw2IV1x]”、“ @UUID[.earBo4vQPC1ti4g7]”与“@UUID[.gAvV8TLyS8UGq00x]”。

original: A burning creature or object takes [[/damage 1d4 type=fire]] damage at the start of each of its turns. As an action, you can extinguish fire on yourself by giving yourself the @UUID[.QxCrRcgMdUd3gfzz]{Prone} condition and rolling on the ground. The fire also goes out if it is doused, submerged, or suffocated.
translation:
燃烧中的生物/物件在每个其回合开始时受到 [[/damage 1d4 type=fire]] 伤害。以一个动作，你可以在地上打滚来熄灭你身上的火焰，并因此陷入 @UUID[.QxCrRcgMdUd3gfzz]状态。

燃烧的火焰同样也会在被浇灭、淹灭、扑灭时消失。

original:
A creature requires an amount of water per day based on its size, as shown in the Water Needs per Day table. A creature that drinks less than half the required water for a day gains 1 Exhaustion level at the day’s end. @UUID[.jSQtPgNm0i4f3Qi3]{Exhaustion} caused by dehydration can’t be removed until the creature drinks the full amount of water required for a day.

Water Needs per Day

Size

Water

Tiny

1/4 gallon

Small

1 gallon

1 gallon

Large

Huge

Gargantuan

translation:
生物每天需要摄入一定量的水分，其需求量由体型决定，如下方每日水分需求表所示。若生物在一天中饮下的水分低于需求量的一半，其在本日结束时会获得1层力竭等级。

因脱水获得的力竭等级，在生物饮下完整一日需求量的水分前无法被移除。另见@UUID[.jSQtPgNm0i4f3Qi3]。

超巨型

original:
A creature that falls takes [[/damage 1d6 type=bludgeoning]] damage at the end of the fall for every 10 feet it fell, to a maximum of [[/damage 20d6 type=bludgeoning]] damage. When the creature lands, it has the @UUID[.QxCrRcgMdUd3gfzz]{Prone} condition unless it avoids taking any damage from the fall.

A creature that falls into water or another liquid can use its @UUID[.OhSIWaQ61dOp7S8M]{Reaction} to make a [[/check dc=15 ath]] or [[/check dc=15 acr]] check to hit the surface head or feet first. On a successful check, any damage resulting from the fall is halved.
translation:
坠落结束时，坠落生物会基于其坠落的距离受到钝击伤害：其每坠落10尺距离，就会受到 [[/damage 1d6 type=bludgeoning]] 伤害（至多 [[/damage 20d6 type=bludgeoning]] ）。当生物着地时，除非它将坠落伤害全数避免，不然它还会因此陷入 @UUID[.QxCrRcgMdUd3gfzz] 状态。

生物坠入水中（或者别的什么液体中）时，其可以用 @UUID[.OhSIWaQ61dOp7S8M]进行一次 [[/check dc=15 ath]] 或 [[/check dc=15 acr]] 检定使自己以头先触水或以脚先触水。若检定成功，该生物所受的、由此次坠落导致的所有伤害将减半。

original:
A creature needs an amount of food per day based on its size, as shown in the Food Needs per Day table. A creature that eats but consumes less than half the required food for a day must succeed on a [[/save dc=10 con]] saving throw or gain 1 &Reference[exhaustion] level at the day’s end. A creature that eats nothing for 5 days automatically gains 1 Exhaustion level at the end of the fifth day as well as an additional level at the end of each subsequent day without food.

Exhaustion caused by malnutrition can’t be removed until the creature eats the full amount of food required for a day.

Food Needs per Day

Size

Food

Size

Food

Tiny

1/4 pound

Large

4 pounds

Small

1 pound

Huge

16 pounds

Medium

1 pound

Gargantuan

64 pounds
translation:
生物每天需要摄入一定量的食物，其需求量由体型决定，如下方每日食物需求表所示。若生物在一天中吃下的食物低于这个量的一半，其在本日结束时必须通过一次 [[/save dc=10 con]] 的体质豁免，否则将会获得1层 &Reference[exhaustion] 。而连续五天什么也不吃的生物会在第五天结束时自动获得1层额外的力竭等级，在这之后若继续什么也不吃，其每天结束时都将会获得1层额外的力竭等级。

因饥饿获得的力竭等级，在生物吃下完整一日需求量的食物前无法被移除。

每日食物需求

食物

食物

1 磅

超巨型
