original: A creature can hold its breath for a number of minutes equal to 1 plus its Constitution modifier (minimum of 30 seconds) before suffocation begins. When a creature runs out of breath or is choking, it gains 1 &Reference[Exhaustion] level at the end of each of its turns. When a creature can breathe again, it removes all levels of Exhaustion it gained from suffocating.
translation: 生物可以屏息至多 1+ 其体质调整值分钟（至少30秒），然后窒息开始。若一个生物的屏息时间殆尽或呼吸受阻，它将在自己的每个回合结束时获得1级 &Reference[Exhaustion] 等级。当生物重新可以呼吸时，所有因窒息而获得的力竭等级都会被移除。

key: entries->Appendix C: Rules Glossary->pages->Area of Effect->name
entries->Appendix C: Rules Glossary->pages->Area of Effect->text
original:
An area of effect has a point of origin, a location from which the effect’s energy erupts. The rules for each shape specify how to position its point of origin. If all straight lines extending from the point of origin to a location in the area of effect are blocked, that location isn’t included in the area of effect. To block a line, an obstruction must provide Total Cover. See also @UUID[.pGXkTaY8kLgqQuDa]{Cover}.

If the creator of an area of effect places it at an unseen point and an obstruction—such as a wall—is between the creator and that point, the point of origin comes into being on the near side of the obstruction.

The descriptions of many spells and other features specify that they have an area of effect, which typically has one of six shapes:

Cone

@Embed[.JwK8XOkGSX9xE5Dc inline]

Cube

@Embed[.p5qUBMQO7shfNeCD inline]

Cylinder

@Embed[.i3ijpxEn5LuSO7C0 inline]

Emanation

@Embed[.eSsITWhcNMkoa9WP inline]

Line

@Embed[.T1ln1l6uKkkMuieP inline]

Sphere

@Embed[.LgpZdAOhTnSHGCNa inline]
translation:
效应范围有一个原点，即效应能量的爆发位置。每种效应范围的规则会指定如何确定其起点位置。如果从起点到效应范围内某个位置的所有直线路径都被阻挡，那么该位置不包括在效应范围内。要阻挡一条路径，障碍物必须提供@UUID[.pGXkTaY8kLgqQuDa]{掩护}。

如果效应范围的创建者将其放置在一个看不见的点上，而这个点和创建者之间有障碍物（如墙壁），那么起点会出现在障碍物的近侧。

许多法术和特性中会提及它们具有效应范围，并通常属于六种形状之一。这些形状的定义在术语表的其他地方：

锥状

@Embed[.JwK8XOkGSX9xE5Dc inline]

立方

@Embed[.p5qUBMQO7shfNeCD inline]

柱状

@Embed[.i3ijpxEn5LuSO7C0 inline]

光环

@Embed[.eSsITWhcNMkoa9WP inline]

线状

@Embed[.T1ln1l6uKkkMuieP inline]

球状

@Embed[.LgpZdAOhTnSHGCNa inline]

original:
An Emanation is an area of effect that extends in straight lines from a creature or an object in all directions. The effect that creates an Emanation specifies the distance it extends.

An Emanation moves with the creature or object that is its origin unless it is an instantaneous or a stationary effect.

An Emanation’s origin (creature or object) isn’t included in the area of effect unless its creator decides otherwise.
translation:
光环是一种效应区域。它是以一名生物或一个物件为源头，向外全部方向扩散的无数直线构成的辐散区域。效应需要创建光环时，其会写明其光环的最大扩散距离。

除非一个光环效应持续时间为立即，或是写明其会固定在原地，否则光环会始终跟随它的源头移动。

光环的源头（生物或物件）不包含在效应区域以内——除非其创造者选择让它包含源头。

original: A monster has a starting attitude toward a player character: &Reference[Friendly], &Reference[Hostile], or &Reference[Indifferent]. See also &Reference[Influence].
translation: 怪物对某名玩家角色的初始态度会是以下之一： &Reference[Friendly], &Reference[Hostile] 或 &Reference[Indifferent]。另见 “&Reference[Influence]”。

original: A Friendly creature views you favorably. You have Advantage on an ability check to influence a Friendly creature. See also &Reference[Influence].
translation: 友好的生物对你的看法是喜爱的、认可的。你尝试影响一个友好生物时，你进行的属性检定具有优势。另见 "&Reference[Influence]"。

original: A Hostile creature views you unfavorably. You have Disadvantage on an ability check to influence a Hostile creature. See also &Reference[Influence].
translation: 敌对的生物对你的看法是厌恶的、反对的。你尝试影响一个敌对生物时，你进行的属性检定具有劣势。另见 “&Reference[Influence]”。

original: An Indifferent creature has no desire to help or hinder you. Indifferent is the default attitude of a monster. See also &Reference[Influence].
translation: 冷漠的生物没有动机去帮助你，亦没有动机去妨碍你。怪物的默认态度为冷漠。另见 “&Reference[Influence]”。

original:
A creature has a Speed, which is the distance in feet the creature can cover when it moves on its turn. See also @UUID[.a4CjDIEMeSbRaEjA]{Climbing}, @UUID[.zRZl7vdjzjqpazxn]{Crawling}, @UUID[.ozHhbP8JVHCJAx0b]{Flying}, @UUID[.aaJOlRhI1H6vAxt9]{Jumping}, @UUID[.53c9JMqckHagYYB5]{Swimming}.

Special Speeds. Some creatures have special speeds, such as a Burrow Speed, Climb Speed, Fly Speed, or Swim Speed, each of which is defined in this glossary. If you have more than one speed, choose which one to use when you move; you can switch between the speeds during your move. Whenever you switch, subtract the distance already moved from the new speed. The result determines how much farther you can move. If the result is 0 or less, you can’t use the new speed during the current move. For example, if you have a Speed of 30 and a Fly Speed of 40, you could fly 10 feet, walk 10 feet, and leap into the air to fly 20 feet more.

Changes to Your Speeds. If an effect increases or decreases your Speed for a time, any special speed you have increases or decreases by an equal amount for the same duration. For example, if your Speed is reduced to 0 and you have a Climb Speed, your Climb Speed is also reduced to 0. Similarly, if your Speed is halved and you have a Fly Speed, your Fly Speed is also halved.
translation:
生物拥有着速度，一个代表着其在自己回合中可以跨过多少距离的数值，单位为尺。另见 @UUID[.a4CjDIEMeSbRaEjA]”、“@UUID[.zRZl7vdjzjqpazxn]”、“@UUID[.ozHhbP8JVHCJAx0b]”、“@UUID[.aaJOlRhI1H6vAxt9]”、“ @UUID[.53c9JMqckHagYYB5]”以及第 1 章（“@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbCombat0000000]”）。

特殊速度。 有些生物拥有特殊速度，例如掘穴速度、攀爬速度、飞行速度、游泳速度（这些速度在术语汇编中均有释义）。如果你拥有超过一种速度，在你移动时你需要选择使用其中的哪个速度，且你可以在移动中更换你所用的速度。

每当你更换速度时，你需要计算新的速度减去你已移动的距离的结果，计算结果决定了在新速度下你还能移动多少距离。如果计算结果为0或者更低，你本次移动将无法使用该新速度。举个例子，如果你有拥有30尺的速度与40尺的飞行速度，你可以先飞行10尺，然后走10尺，最后升到空中再飞20尺。

速度上的变化。 如果某个效应在一段时间增加或减少了你的速度，在那期间内，你拥有的所有特殊速度都会相应地进行加减。举个例子，若你拥有攀爬速度，当你的速度被降至0时，你的攀爬速度也会同样地被降至零。同样的，若你拥有飞行速度，当你的速度被减半时，你的飞行速度也会被减半。

original:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbAppendixDRule.JournalEntryPage.6tqz947qO8vPyxvD inline]

A space is Difficult Terrain if the space contains any of the following or something similar:

  • A creature that isn’t Tiny or your ally

  • Furniture that is sized for creatures of your size or larger

  • Heavy snow, ice, rubble, or undergrowth

  • Liquid that’s between shin- and waist-deep

  • A narrow opening sized for a creature one size smaller than you

  • A slope of 20 degrees or more
translation:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbAppendixDRule.JournalEntryPage.6tqz947qO8vPyxvD inline]

若空间包含下述这些情况之一或类似情况，该空间即为困难地形：

  • 一个既非微型也非盟友的生物

  • 与你体型相仿或比你体型更大的家具

  • 厚积雪、冰面、砂石地或茂密植被

  • 深度及胫到深度及腰的液体

  • 一条只适合给比你体型小一级的生物通过的窄路或缝隙

  • 坡度在20度以上的陡坡

original:
While you’re climbing, each foot of movement costs 1 extra foot (2 extra feet in @UUID[.9tzB6KQDTIuw1FlZ]{Difficult Terrain}). You ignore this extra cost if you have a Climb Speed and use it to climb.

At the DM’s option, climbing a slippery surface or one with few handholds might require a successful [[/check dc=15 ath]] check.
translation:
你攀爬期间，你每移动1尺需要额外消耗1尺移动力（在 @UUID[.9tzB6KQDTIuw1FlZ] 下为额外2尺）。如果你具有攀爬速度，并使用该速度进行攀爬，你可以无视这一额外消耗。

根据DM的判断，攀爬上一个光滑的表面或是没有多少可抓握位置的表面也许需要你通过一次[[/check dc=15 ath]] 检定。

original:
When you jump, you make either a Long Jump (horizontal) or a High Jump (vertical).

@Embed[.NcSh8lVwlfk58VAO inline]

@Embed[.sy6xon5AxuIZV1ca inline]
translation:
当你跳跃时，你进行一次跳远（水平的）或进行一次跳高（垂直的）。

@Embed[.NcSh8lVwlfk58VAO inline]

@Embed[.sy6xon5AxuIZV1ca inline]

original: While you’re swimming, each foot of movement costs 1 extra foot (2 extra feet in @UUID[.9tzB6KQDTIuw1FlZ]{Difficult Terrain}). You ignore this extra cost if you have a Swim Speed and use it to swim. At the DM’s option, moving any distance in rough water might require a successful [[/check dc=15 ath]] check.
translation:
在游泳期间，你每移动1尺需要额外消耗1尺移动力（在 @UUID[.9tzB6KQDTIuw1FlZ])为额外2尺）。如果你具有游泳速度，并使用该速度进行游泳，你可以无视这一额外消耗。

在DM的判断下，在激流的水中移动任意距离也许需要你通过一次 [[/check dc=15 ath]] 检定。

original: Some creatures can hover, as noted in their stat blocks, and some spells and other effects grant the ability to hover. Hovering while flying prevents you from falling in certain circumstances. See also @UUID[.ozHhbP8JVHCJAx0b]{Flying}.
translation: 有些生物可以悬浮，如它们数据卡上写的那样。而有些法术或其他效应能够为生物提供悬浮的能力。悬浮可以在特定场合防止你因飞行而坠落。另见“@UUID[.ozHhbP8JVHCJAx0b]”。

original: An ability check is a D20 Test that represents using one of the six abilities—or a specific skill associated with an ability—to overcome a challenge.
translation: 属性检定是一种 D20 检定，以六项属性之一，或与属性相关的特定技能来克服挑战。

key: entries->Appendix C: Rules Glossary->pages->Ability Score and Modifier->name
entries->Appendix C: Rules Glossary->pages->Ability Score and Modifier->text
original: A creature has six ability scores—Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma—each of which has a corresponding modifier. Add the modifier when you make a &Reference[D20 Test] with the corresponding ability or when a rule asks you to do so.
translation: 生物有六项属性值——力量、敏捷、体质、智力、感知和魅力，每项属性值都有一个对应的调整值。在进行与对应属性相关的 &Reference[D20 Test] 检定，以及规则要求时会加上该调整值。

original: If you have Advantage on a @UUID[.nxPH59t3iNtWJxnU]{D20 Test}, roll two d20s, and use the higher roll. A roll can’t be affected by more than one Advantage, and Advantage and Disadvantage on the same roll cancel each other.
translation: 如果你在 @UUID[.nxPH59t3iNtWJxnU]检定中具有优势，你需要掷两个d20，并使用其中较高的点数。一次检定不会受多个优势影响，而优势和劣势在同一次检定中会相互抵消。

original: D20 Tests encompass the three main d20 rolls of the game: ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. If something in the game affects D20 Tests, it affects all three of these rolls. The DM determines whether a D20 Test is warranted in a given circumstance. See also @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbD20Tests00000]{D20 Tests}.
translation: D20检定包含游戏中最重要的三类D20掷骰：属性检定、攻击检定、豁免检定。如果游戏中的某个东西会影响D20检定，说明这个东西会影响所有这三类的掷骰。在特定情景下，DM可以决定一次D20检定是否可以不进行。另见第 1 章 “@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbD20Tests00000]”。

original: If you have Disadvantage on a &Reference[D20 Test], roll two d20s and use the lower roll. A roll can’t be affected by more than one Disadvantage, and Advantage and Disadvantage on the same roll cancel each other.
translation: 如果你的一次 &Reference[D20 Test]检定具有劣势，投掷两枚D20，并采用两者之间更低一方的骰值。复数劣势不会为此次检定带来额外的影响，且同一检定的优势与劣势之间会互相抵消。

original: An adventure is a series of @UUID[.JEinwUMBhr5bP8PP]{encounters}. A story emerges through playing them.
translation: 冒险是一系列 @UUID[.JEinwUMBhr5bP8PP]。故事就由游玩这一系列遭遇展开。

original: An encounter is a scene in an adventure that is part of at least one of the game’s three pillars: social interaction, exploration, or combat. See also @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbSocialInterac]{Social Interaction}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbExploration00]{Exploration}, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbCombat0000000]{Combat}).
translation: 遭遇是在一场冒险中必不可少的场景，其至少包含游戏的三大支柱要素之一：社交交互、探索、战斗。另见第 1 章（“@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbSocialInterac]”，“@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbExploration00]”，“ @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbCombat0000000]”）。

original: A creature’s alignment broadly describes its ethical attitudes and ideals. Alignment is a combination of two factors: one identifies morality (good, evil, or neutral), and the other describes attitudes toward order (lawful, chaotic, or neutral). These factors allow for nine possible combinations, such as Lawful Good and Neutral Evil.
translation: 生物的阵营大致描述了其道德水准和理想。阵营由两个因素组成：一个锚定道德立场（善良、邪恶或中立），另一个描述对秩序的态度（守序、混乱或中立）。这些因素组合成九种可能的阵营，例如守序善良和中立邪恶。另见第 2 章（“@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbCreatingAChar.JournalEntryPage.6ThVICG0QSRy7L0F]”）。

original: A creature is your ally if it is a member of your adventuring party, your friend, on your side in combat, or a creature that the rules or the DM designates as your ally.
translation: 你的冒险队伍成员、朋友、战斗中的同伴，以及其他由规则或DM指定的生物是为你的盟友。

original: Any being in the game, including a player’s character, is a creature. See also @UUID[.H0gs01OOjU1EJBp9]{Creature Type}.
translation: 游戏中的任何活体（包括玩家角色）均为生物。另见 “@UUID[.H0gs01OOjU1EJBp9]{生物类型}”。

original:
Every creature, including every player character, has a tag in the rules that identifies the type of creature it is. Most player characters are of the Humanoid type. These are the game’s creature types:

  • Aberration

  • Beast

  • Celestial

  • Construct

  • Dragon

  • Elemental

  • Fey

  • Fiend

  • Giant

  • Humanoid

  • Monstrosity

  • Ooze

  • Plant

  • Undead

The types don’t have rules themselves, but some rules in the game affect creatures of certain types in different ways.
translation:
每个生物（包括玩家角色）都在规则中具有一个定义其为何类生物的标签。绝大部分玩家角色的生物类型都是类人。以下是游戏中的生物类型：

  • 异怪

  • 野兽

  • 天界

  • 构装

  • 龙

  • 元素

  • 妖精

  • 邪魔

  • 巨人

  • 类人

  • 怪兽

  • 泥怪

  • 植物

  • 亡灵

这些生物类型自身不具有规则，但游戏的某些规则中存在许多对特定生物类型生物造成与通常不同影响的效应。

original: Some game effects curse a creature or an object. The effect that confers a curse defines what the curse does. Curses can be removed by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplRemoveCurs]{Remove Curse} and @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGreaterRes]{Greater Restoration} spells or other magic that explicitly ends curses.
translation: 有些游戏效应会诅咒一个生物或一个物件。被算作诅咒的效应会写明其诅咒具体能做什么。诅咒可以被法术 @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplRemoveCurs] 和 @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGreaterRes] 移除。类似的，其他提到可以终止诅咒的魔法也可以移除诅咒。

original: Damage represents harm that causes a creature or an object to lose Hit Points.
translation: 伤害是导致某个生物或某个物件损失生命值的损害。

original: A damage roll is a die roll, adjusted by any applicable modifiers, that deals damage to a target. See also @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbDamageAndHeal]{Damage and Healing}.
translation: 伤害掷骰是决定将对目标造成多少伤害的一次掷骰，将被任何可以加入的调整值影响。另见 “@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbDamageAndHeal]”。

original: A creature or an object that has a damage threshold has Immunity to all damage unless it takes an amount of damage from a single attack or effect equal to or greater than its damage threshold, in which case it takes that entire instance of damage. Any damage that fails to meet or exceed the damage threshold is superficial and doesn’t reduce Hit Points. For example, if an object has a damage threshold of 10, the object takes no damage if 9 damage is dealt to it, since that damage fails to exceed the threshold. If the same object is dealt 11 damage, it takes all of that damage.
translation: 拥有伤害阈值的生物/物件免疫于一切伤害，除非它所承受的单次伤害的数额等于或超出了它的伤害阈值——在这种情况下，该生物/物件将承受完整的伤害。任何未达到伤害阈值的伤害都只是表面上造成了伤害，实际并没有减损生命值。举个例子，如果一个物件具有10点伤害阈值，受到对其造成的9点伤害时，该物件不会受到伤害——因为这个伤害没有达到伤害阈值。如果同一个物件被造成了11点伤害，该物件会受到全额的伤害。

original:
Attacks and other harmful effects deal different types of damage. Damage types have no rules of their own, but other rules, such as Resistance, rely on the types. The Damage Types table offers examples to help a DM assign a type to a new effect.

Damage Types

Type

Examples

Acid

Corrosive liquids, digestive enzymes

Bludgeoning

Blunt objects, constriction, falling

Cold

Freezing water, icy blasts

Fire

Flames, unbearable heat

Force

Pure magical energy

Lightning

Electricity

Necrotic

Life-draining energy

Piercing

Fangs, puncturing objects

Poison

Toxic gas, venom

Psychic

Mind-rending energy

Radiant

Holy energy, searing radiation

Slashing

Claws, cutting objects

Thunder

Concussive sound
translation:
攻击以及其他伤害性效应可以造成各种不同类型的伤害。伤害类型自身没有规则，但其他规则（例如抗性）会基于伤害类型。伤害类型表提供了一些例子，可用于帮助DM为一个新效应选用伤害类型。

伤害类型

类型

示例

强酸

腐蚀性液体，消化酶

钝击

钝器，压紧，坠落

寒冷

冰水，寒风

火焰

烈焰，难以忍受的高温

力场

纯粹的魔法能量

闪电

高压电

暗蚀

窃取生命的能量

穿刺

獠牙，刺穿

毒素

毒性气体，蛇毒

心灵

摧毁心灵的能量

光耀

神圣能量，炽热的辐射

挥砍

爪子，切割用具

雷鸣

足以形成冲击波的响声

key: entries->Appendix C: Rules Glossary->pages->Death Saving Throw->name
entries->Appendix C: Rules Glossary->pages->Death Saving Throw->text
original: A player character must make a Death Saving Throw (also called a Death Save) if they start their turn with 0 Hit Points. See also @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbDamageAndHeal]{Damage and Healing}.
translation: 若玩家角色在其回合开始时生命值为0，其必须进行一次死亡豁免检定（又称 死亡豁免Death Save ）。另见第 1 章（“@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbDamageAndHeal]”）。

original:
A dead creature has no Hit Points and can’t regain them unless it is first revived by magic such as the Raise Dead or Revivify spell. When such a spell is cast, the spirit knows who is casting it and can refuse. The spirit of a dead creature has left the body and departed for the Outer Planes, and reviving the creature requires calling the spirit back.

If the creature returns to life, the revival effect determines the creature’s current Hit Points. Unless otherwise stated, the creature returns to life with any conditions, magical contagions, or curses that were affecting it at death if the durations of those effects are still ongoing. If the creature died with any @UUID[.jSQtPgNm0i4f3Qi3]{Exhaustion} levels, it returns with 1 fewer level. If the creature had Attunement to one or more magic items, it is no longer attuned to them.
translation:
死亡的生物没有生命值也无法恢复生命值，只有先被魔法复活（例如法术 死者复活或法术 回生术）之后才能恢复生命值。当此类法术被施展时，死者的灵魂可以知晓谁施展了这个法术，并可以选择拒绝被复活。死亡生物的灵魂若已离开其身体并前往了外层位面，则复活该生物还需要呼唤其灵魂归来。

当生物重拾生命时，那个回生效应会决定该生物的当前生命值。若无特殊说明，生物在重拾生命时，其死亡之前具有的任何持续时间未结束的状态、魔法疫病以及诅咒都会继续维持原样。如果生物死亡时具有任何 @UUID[.jSQtPgNm0i4f3Qi3] 等级，其重拾生命时具有的力竭等级减少1层。如果生物死亡时与任何魔法物品同调，死亡后这些同调也将解除。

original:
A Difficulty Class (DC) is the target number for an ability check or a saving throw. See also chapter 1

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbD20Tests00000]{D20 Tests}.
translation:
难度等级（DC）是属性检定与豁免检定的目标数值。另见第 1 章（“

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbD20Tests00000]”）。

original: A creature is your enemy if it fights against you in combat, actively works to harm you, or is designated as your enemy by the rules or DM.
translation:
一个正在战斗中对抗你的生物或者对你造成实际损害行为的生物，就是你的敌人。

如果规则或DM设计上认为某个生物是你的敌人，那么这个生物也是你的敌人。

original:
As they overcome challenges and complete adventures, characters earn Experience Points (XP), which are awarded by the Dungeon Master. When a character’s XP total crosses certain thresholds, the character’s level increases. The Dungeon Master’s Guide provides guidance on awarding XP.

See also @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbCreatingAChar.JournalEntryPage.Vz5QcYKA74tWkDqy]{Level Advancement}.
translation: 在角色们经历了重重考验，完成冒险后，角色们将获得经验值（XP）——一种由DM赠与的奖赏。当角色的总XP超过了一定阈值后，角色的等级将提升。《地下城主指南》提供了奖赏经验的指引。另见第 2 章（“ @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbCreatingAChar.JournalEntryPage.Vz5QcYKA74tWkDqy]”）。

original:
Expertise is a feature that enhances your use of a skill proficiency. When you make an ability check with a skill proficiency in which you have Expertise, your Proficiency Bonus is doubled for that check unless the bonus is doubled by another feature.

If you gain Expertise, you gain it in one skill in which you have proficiency. You can’t have Expertise in the same skill proficiency more than once.

See also chapter 1 @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbPlayingTheGam]{Proficiency}.
translation:
专精是可以增强你某项技能熟练的使用效果的特性。当你使用具有专精的技能熟练进行一次属性检定，此次检定中加入的熟练加值加倍。如果已有其他特性使你的熟练加值加倍，专精不会有效果。

当你获得专精特性时，你需要选择一项你具有熟练的技能来获得专精。在同一项技能熟练中，你只能应用一次专精特性。

另见 第 1 章（“@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbPlayingTheGam]”） 。

original: A Fly Speed can be used to travel through the air. While you have a Fly Speed, you can stay aloft until you land, fall, or die. See also &Reference[Flying] and &Reference[Speed].
translation: 有许多效果都能让生物飞起来。飞行期间，若你陷入失能状态、陷入倒地状态或是你的飞行速度被降至0时，你将坠落。如果你具有悬浮能力，你在遇到这些情况的时候可以保持悬停在原位。另见“ &Reference[Flying] ”和“ &Reference[Speed]”。

original: A creature that has a Burrow Speed can use that speed to move through sand, earth, mud, or ice. The creature can’t burrow through solid rock unless the creature has a trait that allows it to do so.
translation: 具有掘穴速度的生物可以以此穿过沙子、泥土、淤泥或冰块进行移动。生物通常无法利用掘穴速度穿过坚固的岩石，除非该生物具有相应的特质使其可以这么做。

original: A Climb Speed can be used in place of &reference[Speed] to traverse a vertical surface without expending the extra movement normally associated with climbing.
translation: 攀爬速度可以作为在垂直表面上移动的速度使用，且不需要因攀爬而额外消耗移动力。另见 “&reference[Speed]” 与 “@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbAppendixCRule.JournalEntryPage.a4CjDIEMeSbRaEjA]”

original: A Swim Speed can be used to swim without expending the extra movement normally associated with swimming. See also @UUID[.53c9JMqckHagYYB5]{Swimming} and &Reference[Speed].
translation: 游泳速度可以作为游泳时的速度使用，且不需要因游泳而额外消耗移动力。另见“ @UUID[.53c9JMqckHagYYB5]”与“&Reference[Speed]”。

original:
A creature can grapple another creature. Characters typically grapple by using an Unarmed Strike. Many monsters have special attacks that allow them to quickly grapple prey. However a grapple is initiated, it follows these rules. See also @UUID[.2Uvc5myrDs18Cf19]{Unarmed Strike} and &Reference[Grappled].

Grappled Condition. Successfully grappling a creature gives it the Grappled condition.

One Grapple per Hand. A creature must have a hand free to grapple another creature. Some stat blocks and game effects allow a creature to grapple using a tentacle, a maw, or another body part. Whatever part a grappler uses, it can grapple only one creature at a time with that part, and the grappler can’t use that part to target another creature unless it ends the grapple.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbAppendixDRule.JournalEntryPage.2TZKy9YbMN3ZY3h8 inline]
translation:
生物可以去擒抱其他的生物。角色们通常会使用徒手打击来发动擒抱，而许多怪物拥有一些能够快速擒抱他人的特殊攻击。不论擒抱是以何种方式出现的，它均遵循以下规则。另见“ @UUID[.2Uvc5myrDs18Cf19]”和“ &Reference[Grappled]”。

受擒状态。成功擒抱一个生物时，将对该生物施加受擒状态。

一手一擒。生物必须用一只空闲的手去擒抱另一个生物。有些数据卡与游戏效应允许生物使用触手、颚或者别的什么身体部位去擒抱别的生物。不论用什么部位去擒抱，擒抱者的那个部位在同一时间都只能擒抱一个生物，即在擒抱终止前，擒抱者无法对除擒抱对象以外的生物使用那个部位。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbAppendixDRule.JournalEntryPage.2TZKy9YbMN3ZY3h8 inline]

original:
Instead of using a weapon to make a melee attack, you can use a punch, kick, head-butt, or similar forceful blow. In game terms, this is an Unarmed Strike—a melee attack that involves you using your body to damage, grapple, or shove a target within 5 feet of you.

Whenever you use your Unarmed Strike, choose one of the following options for its effect.

Damage. You make an attack roll against the target. Your bonus to the roll equals your Strength modifier plus your Proficiency Bonus. On a hit, the target takes Bludgeoning damage equal to 1 plus your Strength modifier.

Grapple. The target must succeed on a Strength or Dexterity saving throw (it chooses which), or it has the @UUID[.KbQ1k0OIowtZeQgp]{Grappled} condition. The DC for the saving throw and any escape attempts equals 8 plus your Strength modifier and Proficiency Bonus. This grapple is possible only if the target is no more than one size larger than you and if you have a hand free to grab it. See also @UUID[.YSLWJcQCP6kzsPql]{Grappling}.

Shove. The target must succeed on a Strength or Dexterity saving throw (it chooses which), or you either push it 5 feet away or cause it to have the @UUID[.QxCrRcgMdUd3gfzz]{Prone} condition. The DC for the saving throw equals 8 plus your Strength modifier and Proficiency Bonus. This shove is possible only if the target is no more than one size larger than you.
translation:
用武器发动近战攻击时，作为代替，你可以用你的拳头、踢腿、头槌或是类似的强力肢体攻击发动这次近战攻击。在游戏术语上，这被称为徒手打击——一种用你的身体，去伤害、擒抱或推撞位于你5尺内的目标的近战攻击。

每当你使用徒手打击时，选择以下效果选项之一：

伤害。 你对目标进行一次攻击检定，此次攻击的加值为你的力量调整值 + 你的熟练加值。命中时，目标将受到 1 + 你的力量调整值点钝击伤害。

擒抱。 目标必须通过一次力量或敏捷豁免检定（由目标选择），否则将 &reference[Grappled] 此次豁免的DC与任何逃脱行为的DC均等于 8 + 你的力量调整值 + 你的熟练加值。你只能擒抱体型至多比你大一级的生物，且你需要一只空着的手才能抓住它。另见 &reference[Grappling]。

推撞。 目标必须通过一次力量或敏捷豁免检定（由目标选择），否则将被你推开5尺距离或陷入 &reference[Prone] 状态（由你选择）。此次豁免的DC等于8+你的力量调整值+你的熟练加值。你只能推撞体型至多比你大一级的生物。

original: Healing is how you regain Hit Points. See also @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbDamageAndHeal]{Damage and Healing}.
translation: 治疗即是你回复生命值的方式。另见第 1 章（“ @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbDamageAndHeal] ”）。

original:
If you (a player character) have Heroic Inspiration, you can expend it to reroll any die immediately after rolling it, and you must use the new roll.

If you gain Heroic Inspiration but already have it, it’s lost unless you give it to a player character who lacks it.
translation:
如果你（一名玩家角色）拥有英雄激励，你可以在投掷任何骰子后，消耗激励来重骰它。但你必须选用新的投掷结果。

获得新的英雄激励时，如果你已有英雄激励，该英雄激励消失，除非你将其给予另一个没有英雄激励的玩家角色。

original:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbAppendixDRule.JournalEntryPage.PFbzoMBviI2DD9QP inline]

See also @UUID[.RXTLVpAwcGm1qtKf]{Breaking Objects} and @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbDamageAndHeal]{Damage and Healing}.

key: entries->Appendix C: Rules Glossary->pages->Hit Point Dice->name
entries->Appendix C: Rules Glossary->pages->Hit Point Dice->text
original: Hit Point Dice, or Hit Dice for short, help determine a player character’s Hit Point maximum, as explained in chapter 2. Most monsters also have Hit Dice. A creature can spend Hit Dice during a @UUID[.wVuNbEADtC16ejAi]{Short Rest} to regain Hit Points.
translation: 生命值骰（或称生命骰）是协助决定一名玩家角色生命值上限的一个因素，在第 2 章中有所解释。大多数怪物同样拥有生命骰。一个生物可以在短休中消耗生命骰来恢复生命值。另见“@UUID[.wVuNbEADtC16ejAi]”。

original:
A Short Rest is a 1-hour period of downtime, during which a creature does nothing more strenuous than reading, talking, eating, or standing watch. To start a Short Rest, you must have at least 1 Hit Point.

Benefits of the Rest. When you finish the rest, you gain the following benefits:

Spend Hit Point Dice. You can spend one or more of your Hit Point Dice to regain Hit Points. For each Hit Point Die you spend in this way, roll the die and add your Constitution modifier to it. You regain Hit Points equal to the total (minimum of 1 Hit Point). You can decide to spend an additional Hit Point Die after each roll.

Special Feature. Some features are recharged by a Short Rest. If you have such a feature, it recharges in the way specified in its description.

Interrupting the Rest. A Short Rest is stopped by the following interruptions:

  • Rolling Initiative
  • Casting a spell other than a cantrip
  • Taking any damage

An interrupted Short Rest confers no benefits.
translation:
短休是一段1小时长的休整时刻，在这期间，生物不能做任何比阅读、交谈、进食或站岗更费力的事情。你必须具有至少1点生命值才能开始一次短休。

短休的增益。 当你完成短休时，你将获得以下这些增益：

消耗生命值骰。 你可以消耗一颗（或更多）你的生命值骰以恢复生命值。你投掷任意枚生命骰，并加上等于你投掷次数倍的体质调整值。你恢复等于总数点生命值（至少1点）。你可以在每次投掷后再决定是否要额外消耗一枚生命值骰。

特殊特性。 有些特性会在短休时恢复。如果你拥有此类特性，短休完成时这些特性会以它们自己描述中写明的方式恢复。

打断短休。 一次短休会因以下这些原因而打断：

  • 投掷先攻
  • 施展一道非戏法的法术
  • 受到任何伤害

一次被打断的短休不会提供任何增益。

original:
A Long Rest is a period of extended downtime—at least 8 hours—available to any creature. During a Long Rest, you sleep for at least 6 hours and perform no more than 2 hours of light activity, such as reading, talking, eating, or standing watch.

During sleep, you have the &Reference[Unconscious] condition. After you finish a Long Rest, you must wait at least 16 hours before starting another one.

Benefits of the Rest. To start a Long Rest, you must have at least 1 Hit Point. When you finish the rest, you gain the following benefits:

Regain All HP. You regain all lost Hit Points and all spent Hit Point Dice. If your Hit Point maximum was reduced, it returns to normal.

Ability Scores Restored. If any of your ability scores were reduced, they return to normal.

Exhaustion Reduced. If you have the &Reference[Exhaustion] condition, its level decreases by 1.

Special Feature. Some features are recharged by a Long Rest. If you have such a feature, it recharges in the way specified in its description.

Interrupting the Rest. A Long Rest is stopped by the following interruptions:

  • Rolling Initiative
  • Casting a spell other than a cantrip
  • Taking any damage
  • 1 hour of walking or other physical exertion

If you rested at least 1 hour before the interruption, you gain the benefits of a @UUID[.wVuNbEADtC16ejAi]{Short Rest}.

You can resume a Long Rest immediately after an interruption. If you do so, the rest requires 1 additional hour per interruption to finish.
translation:
长休指的是一段长时间的休整期（至少8小时），任何生物都可以进行长休。在一次长休期间，你进行至少6小时的睡眠，并进行至多2小时的轻度活动，例如阅读、交谈、进食或站岗。

睡眠期间，你陷入昏迷状态。完成一次长休后，你必须等待至少16小时后才能开始另一次长休。

长休的增益。 你必须具有至少1点生命值才能开始一次长休，当你完成长休时，你将获得以下这些增益：

恢复全部生命值。 你恢复所有已损失的生命值并重获所有已消耗的生命值骰。如果你的生命值上限被减少了，那么其在此时也会恢复原状。

属性值恢复。 如果你的某项属性值被减少了，那么其在此时会恢复原状。

力竭消退。 如果你具有力竭等级，你的力竭等级减少1层。

特殊特性。 有些特性会在长休时恢复。如果你拥有此类特性，长休完成时这些特性会以它们自己描述中写明的方式恢复。

打断长休。 一次长休会因下列原因而被打断：

  • 投掷先攻
  • 施展一道非戏法的法术
  • 受到任何伤害
  • 1小时的行走或其他的体力劳动

如果你在长休被打断之前休息了至少1小时，你可以获得一次短休的增益。

你可以在被打断后立刻继续你的长休，但为了完成这次长休，每被打断一次你就需要额外休息1小时。

original:
Spells and other effects sometimes create magical illusions. Such an effect defines what the illusion does and which senses or mental faculties it deceives.

If an illusion manifests in space, the illusion is insubstantial and weightless, yet it seems to be affected by the environment as if the illusion were real unless the effect that created it specifies otherwise. For example, a visual illusion of a creature casts shadows and reflections, and wind appears to affect the illusory creature. Similarly, an audible illusion echoes in an echoey space.
translation:
有些法术或其他效应会创造出魔法性的幻象。此类效应会写明其幻象能做到什么以及能够被何种感官或精神能力观察到。

若幻象在某处空间中显现，幻象将是没有实体也不具备重量的，但其看上去似乎会受环境影响，如同这个幻象真实处于那处空间一般——除非创造该幻象的效应声明其例外。举个例子，一道生物样子的视觉性幻象会投射影子和倒影，而风吹过时幻象也会受到类似的影响。同样的，一道听觉性幻象也会在合适的空间产生回声。

original: If you have Immunity to a damage type or a condition, it doesn’t affect you in any way.
translation: 如果你拥有某项伤害类型或是某项状态的免疫，该类型伤害/状态以任何方式都无法影响你。

original:
An improvised weapon is an object wielded as a makeshift weapon, such as broken glass, a table leg, or a frying pan. A Simple or Martial weapon also counts as an improvised weapon if it’s wielded in a way contrary to its design; if you use a Ranged weapon to make a melee attack or throw a Melee weapon that lacks the Thrown property, the weapon counts as an improvised weapon. An improvised weapon follows the rules below.

Proficiency. Don’t add your Proficiency Bonus to attack rolls with an improvised weapon.

Damage. On a hit, the weapon deals [[/damage 1d4]] damage of a type the DM thinks is appropriate for the object.

Range. If you throw the weapon, it has a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet.

Weapon Equivalents. If an improvised weapon resembles a Simple or Martial weapon, the DM may say it functions as that weapon and uses that weapon’s rules. For example, the DM could treat a table leg as a Club.
translation:
将物件（例如碎玻璃片、桌腿、烤盘）当做凑合用的武器持用时，这一物品便被称为临时武器。以不合设计的方式持用的简易武器与军用武器也会被算作临时武器——用远程武器发动近战攻击或是将非投掷的近战武器投掷出去时，该远程武器/近战武器也同样被算作临时武器。一把临时武器遵循以下这些规则：

熟练。 不要把你的熟练加值加到以临时武器进行的攻击检定里。

伤害。 命中时，武器将造成 [[/damage 1d4]] 伤害，伤害类型为DM认为的最适合此物件的类型。

射程。如果你投掷一把临时武器，其投掷常规射程为20尺，最大射程为60尺。

等效与武器。 如果一把临时武器与某个简易/军用武器十分相似，DM也许可以称“这把临时武器可以作为那把武器使用，遵循那把武器的规则”。举个例子，DM可以将一个桌腿视为一根短棍。

key: entries->Appendix C: Rules Glossary->pages->Knocking Out a Creature->name
entries->Appendix C: Rules Glossary->pages->Knocking Out a Creature->text
original:
When you would reduce a creature to 0 Hit Points with a melee attack, you can instead reduce the creature to 1 Hit Point. The creature then has the @UUID[.fZCRaKEJd4KoQCqH]{Unconscious} condition and starts a @UUID[.wVuNbEADtC16ejAi]{Short Rest}.

The creature remains Unconscious until it regains any Hit Points or until someone uses an action to administer first aid to it, which requires a successful [[/check dc=10 med]] check.
translation:
当你的近战攻击即将令某个生物的生命值降至0时，你可以改为令那个生物降至1点生命值。然后该生物将陷入 @UUID[.fZCRaKEJd4KoQCqH]{昏迷} 状态并开始一次短休。

该生物将一直保持昏迷，直到其恢复任何生命值或某人用动作施予救治。救治昏迷生物需要通过一次 [[/check dc=10 med]] 检定。

original: An effect is magical if it is created by a spell, a magic item, or a phenomenon that a rule labels as magical.
translation:
由法术、魔法物品创造出来的效应即为魔法效应。

如果一个事物的规则写明了它是魔法性的，那么它也属于魔法效应。

original: A monster is a creature controlled by the DM, even if the creature is benevolent. See also @UUID[.qt6cd0mBRQhsElwd]{Creature} and @UUID[.VNSwzt3GIwcM3Iil]{NPC}.
translation: 怪物即为那些由DM操控的生物，即使是无暴力倾向的生物也属于怪物。另见“@UUID[.qt6cd0mBRQhsElwd]”和“ @UUID[.VNSwzt3GIwcM3Iil]”。

original: A nonplayer character (NPC) is a monster that has a personal name and a distinct personality. See also @UUID[.gTBHin4uKrs9cjjW]{Monster}.
translation: 怪物即为那些由DM操控的生物，即使是无暴力倾向的生物也属于怪物。另见“ @UUID[.gTBHin4uKrs9cjjW]”。

original: An object is a nonliving, distinct thing. Composite things, like buildings, comprise more than one object. See also @UUID[.RXTLVpAwcGm1qtKf]{Breaking Objects}.
translation: 物件是无生命的、显而易见的东西。复合的东西（例如建筑物），由超过一件的物件组成。另见“ @UUID[.RXTLVpAwcGm1qtKf]”。

original: A space is occupied if a creature is in it or if it is completely filled by objects.
translation: 如果一处空间中有着某个生物处于其中或是该空间被物件所完全填充满，那么这个空间就是已被占据的。

original: You can make an Opportunity Attack when a creature that you can see leaves your reach using its action, its Bonus Action, its Reaction, or one of its speeds. To make the Opportunity Attack, take a Reaction to make one melee attack with a weapon or an Unarmed Strike against the provoking creature. The attack occurs right before the creature leaves your reach. See also chapter @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbCombat0000000]{Combat}.
translation: 当你可见的生物，使用其动作、其附赠动作、其反应或者其任一速度尝试离开你的触及范围时，你可以对其发动一次借机攻击。为发动借机攻击，你执行你的反应，用武器或徒手打击对引发借机的生物发动一次近战攻击。此次攻击发生在该生物离开你触及范围之前的一瞬间。 另见“ @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbCombat0000000]”。

original:
Passive Perception is a score that reflects a creature’s general awareness of its surroundings. The DM uses this score when determining whether a creature notices something without consciously making a Wisdom (Perception) check.

A creature’s Passive Perception equals 10 plus the creature’s Wisdom (Perception) check bonus. If the creature has Advantage on such checks, increase the score by 5. If the creature has &Reference[Disadvantage] on them, decrease the score by 5. For example, a level 1 character with a Wisdom of 15 and proficiency in Perception has a Passive Perception of 14 (10 + 2 + 2). If that character has Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks, the score becomes 19.
translation:
被动察觉是一项决定生物感知周遭威胁的常态能力的数值。DM会使用这项数值，便于在不直接进行感知（察觉）检定的情况下决定一个生物是否能注意到某些事物。

一个生物的被动察觉等于 10 + 该生物的感知（察觉）检定加值。如果该生物具有此类检定的优势，此数值增加5。如果该生物具有此类检定的 &Reference[Disadvantage] ，此数值减少5。举个例子，一名具有15点感知属性与察觉技能熟练的1级角色，其被动察觉为14（10+2+2）。如果该生物具有感知（察觉）检定的优势，被动察觉数值将变为19。

（译注：虽然此处用的是“加值”，但WSZ的实际例子中也包括了减值）

original: If a rule says you can use something a certain number of times per day, that means you must finish a @UUID[.NGmwolHLA5ppbIZY]{Long Rest} to use it again after you run out of uses.
translation: 如果规则称“你可以每日使用某项物品若干次”，这说明你在用完次数后，你必须完成一次 @UUID[.NGmwolHLA5ppbIZY] 才能再次使用它。

original: A player character is a character controlled by a player. See also @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbCreatingAChar]{chapter 2}.
translation: 玩家角色即为由玩家操控的角色。另见 @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbCreatingAChar]{第 2 章}。

original: Some effects cause a creature to be possessed by another creature or entity. A possessing effect defines how the possession operates. Possession can be prevented by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbEvilAndGoodPr]{Protection from Evil and Good} spell and ended by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDispelEvil]{Dispel Evil and Good} spell.
translation: 有些效应可能导致生物被另一个生物/实体附身。附身的效应中会定义其附身是如何运作的。附身可以被法术 @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbEvilAndGoodPr]防范，且可以被法术 @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDispelEvil] 终止。

original: If you have proficiency with something, you can add your Proficiency Bonus to any @UUID[.nxPH59t3iNtWJxnU]{D20 Test} you make using that thing. A creature might have proficiency in a skill or saving throw or with a weapon or tool.
translation: 如果你具有某个事物的熟练，你就可以在任何使用该事物的 @UUID[.nxPH59t3iNtWJxnU] 检定中加入你的熟练加值。生物也许会拥有某个技能的熟练、某种豁免的熟练、某把武器的熟练、某件工具的熟练。

original: If you have Resistance to a damage type, damage of that type is halved against you (round down). Resistance is applied only once to an instance of damage. See also @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbDamageAndHeal]{Damage and Healing}.
translation: 如果你具有某项伤害类型的抗性，你所受的该类型伤害将被减半（向下取整）。对于每个伤害实例而言，抗性只会生效一次。另见第 1 章（“ @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbDamageAndHeal]”）。

original: If you have a spell prepared that has the Ritual tag, you can cast that spell as a Ritual. The Ritual version of a spell takes 10 minutes longer to cast than normal. It also doesn’t expend a spell slot, which means the ritual version of a spell can’t be cast at a higher level. See also @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbSpells0000000]{chapter 7}.
translation: 如果你准备的某个法术具有仪式标签，你就可以以仪式的方式施展这个法术。仪式版的该法术的施法时间比常规情况多10分钟。仪式不消耗法术位，但这同样意味着仪式版的法术无法升环施展。另见@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbSpells0000000]{第 7 章}.

original: Whenever you divide or multiply a number in the game, round down if you end up with a fraction, even if the fraction is one-half or greater. Some rules make an exception and tell you to round up.
translation: 每当你在游戏里对某个数字进行除法或乘法运算时，如果最终结果有小数部分，向下取整。即使小数部分超过了0.5，你也要向下取整。不过部分规则会做出例外，告诉你要向上取整。

original: Save is another name for a saving throw. See also @UUID[.Vlri6Mp6grn9wt3g]{Saving Throw}.
translation: 豁免是豁免检定的另一个名字。另见“ @UUID[.Vlri6Mp6grn9wt3g]”。

original: A saving throw—also called a save—represents an attempt to avoid or resist a threat. You normally make a saving throw only when a rule requires you to do so, but you can decide to fail the save without rolling. The result of a save is detailed in the effect that allowed it. If a target is forced to make a save and lacks the ability score used by it, the target automatically fails. See also chapter 1 @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbD20Tests00000]{D20 Tests}.
translation: 豁免检定（又称豁免）是为某个来袭的威胁所做的躲避/抵抗。通常只有在规则需要你进行某个豁免检定的时候，你才会进行豁免检定，但进行豁免时，你可以决定主动失败于此次豁免而无需掷骰。一次豁免的结果由要求豁免的那个效应详细说明。如果一名目标被迫使进行一次豁免，但又不具备所对应的属性值，该目标将自动豁免失败。另见第 1 章（“ @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbD20Tests00000]”）。

original: If an effect, such as @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.classes.Item.phbdrdWildShape0]{Wild Shape} or the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPolymorph0]{Polymorph} spell, lets you shape-shift, its description specifies what happens to you. Unless that description says otherwise, any ongoing effects on you—conditions, spells, curses, and the like—carry over from one form to the other. You revert to your true form if you die.
translation: 如果一个效应（例如 @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.classes.Item.phbdrdWildShape0]或法术 @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPolymorph0] ）让你变形，其描述会写明你身上会发生什么。除非描述文本说明例外，否则任何正在你身上生效的效应——状态、法术、诅咒以及类似的东西——都会被从一个形态携带到另一个形态上。若你死亡，你将变回你的真实形态。

original: If two or more things happen at the same time on a turn, the person at the game table—player or DM—whose turn it is decides the order in which those things happen. For example, if two effects occur at the start of a player character’s turn, the player decides which of the effects happens first.
translation: 如果两起以上的事件同时发生在某一回合中，那么将由游戏桌上轮到这个回合的人——玩家或DM——来决定这些事件发生的顺序。举个例子，若有两个效应在某位玩家角色的回合开始时同时生效，则由该玩家决定两个效应中的哪一个先生效。

original: A creature or an object belongs to a size category: Tiny, Small, Medium, Large, Huge, or Gargantuan. A creature’s size determines how much space the creature occupies in combat. An object’s size affects its Hit Points. See also @UUID[.RXTLVpAwcGm1qtKf]{Breaking Objects} and @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbCombat0000000]{Combat}.
translation: 生物与物件将会隶属于以下体型类别之一：微型、小型、中型、大型、巨型或超巨型。生物的体型决定了该生物在战斗中需要占据多大的空间。而物件的体型会影响其生命值。另见“ @UUID[.RXTLVpAwcGm1qtKf]”和第 1 章（“ @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbCombat0000000]”）。

original: A skill is an area of specialization associated with an ability check. If you have proficiency in a skill, you can add your Proficiency Bonus when you make an ability check associated with that skill. See also @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbD20Tests00000.JournalEntryPage.zU9fgQbLaVbJvPRX]{Proficiency}
translation: 一项技能对应着一个与某项属性检定相关的专业知识分野。若你具有某项技能的熟练，你就可以在你进行的、与该技能相关的属性检定中，加入你的熟练加值。另见第1章（“ @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbD20Tests00000.JournalEntryPage.zU9fgQbLaVbJvPRX]”）。

original: A spell is a magical effect that has the characteristics described in @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbSpells0000000.JournalEntryPage.dWVioXxEGjcPsI9Y]{chapter 7}.
translation: 法术是一种有着某些特定特征的魔法效应，这些特征在 @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbSpells0000000.JournalEntryPage.dWVioXxEGjcPsI9Y]{第 7 章} 有所表述。

original: A spell attack is an attack roll made as part of a spell or another magical effect. See also @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbSpells0000000.JournalEntryPage.iBFe4NyaCUinDoz3]{Casting Spells}.
translation: 法术攻击即为作为某个法术（或其他魔法效应）的一部分进行的攻击检定。另见第 7 章（“@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbSpells0000000.JournalEntryPage.iBFe4NyaCUinDoz3]”）。

original: A Spellcasting Focus is an object that certain creatures can use in place of a spell’s Material components if those materials aren’t consumed by the spell and don’t have a cost specified. Some classes allow its members to use certain types of Spellcasting Focuses. See also @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbSpells0000000.JournalEntryPage.iBFe4NyaCUinDoz3]{Casting Spells}.
translation: 法器是一件可以由特定生物用以代替不会被法术所消耗且未标明价格的材料成分的物件。有些职业可以让该职业的角色使用某个特定类型的法器。另见第 7 章（“ @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbSpells0000000.JournalEntryPage.iBFe4NyaCUinDoz3]”）。

original: A creature is Stable if it has 0 Hit Points but isn’t required to make @UUID[.VtyVX7M159v6UVqG]{Death Saving Throws}. See also @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbDamageAndHeal]{Damage and Healing}.
translation: 若生物具有0点生命值但不需要再进行 @UUID[.VtyVX7M159v6UVqG] 检定，该生物即为伤势稳定。另见第 1 章（“ @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbDamageAndHeal]”）。

original:
A stat block contains the game statistics of a monster. Each stat block includes the following information presented after the monster’s name.

Size. A monster is Tiny, Small, Medium, Large, Huge, or Gargantuan.

Creature Type. This entry notes the family of beings a monster belongs to, along with any descriptive tags.

Alignment. An alignment is suggested for the monster, with the DM determining its actual alignment.

AC, Initiative, and HP. These entries give the monster’s Armor Class, Initiative, and Hit Points, which are detailed in chapter 1. In parentheses after the Hit Points, the monster’s Hit Point Dice are provided, along with the contribution of its Constitution, if any, to its Hit Points. Following the Initiative modifier is an Initiative score. Some creatures that are created by magic lack Hit Dice and Initiative information.

Speed. Here the monster’s Speed is provided, along with any special speeds.

Ability Scores. A table provides the monster’s ability scores, modifiers, and saving throw modifiers, all of which are detailed in @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbPlayingTheGam.JournalEntryPage.sIPPXW1mYE3O4xdc]{chapter 1}.

Skills. This entry lists the monster’s skill proficiencies, if any. See also @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbD20Tests00000.JournalEntryPage.zU9fgQbLaVbJvPRX]{Proficiency}.

Resistances and Vulnerabilities. These entries list the monster’s Resistances and Vulnerabilities, if any. See also &Reference[Resistance] and @UUID[.bCU0JHnmZsZf1SHp]{Vulnerability}.

Immunities. This section lists the monster’s damage and condition Immunities, if any. See also @UUID[.vuK6Tth0DFgU74A6]{Immunity}.

Gear. If the monster has any equipment that can be given away or retrieved, it’s listed in this entry.

Senses. This entry lists the monster’s special senses, such as Darkvision, and its Passive Perception. See also @UUID[.Brc9AnUXBeg0MTX6]{Passive Perception}.

Languages. This entry lists any languages the monster knows.

CR. Challenge Rating summarizes the threat a monster poses and is detailed in the Monster Manual. The Experience Points characters receive for defeating a monster and its Proficiency Bonus follow. Some creatures that are created by magic have no CR. See also @UUID[.BMoxmXB8pX6bOBus]{Challenge Rating} and @UUID[.DksBBFbqPY2FCReT]{Experience Points}.

Traits. The monster’s traits, if any, are features that are active at all times or in certain situations.

Actions. The monster can take these actions in addition to those detailed in this glossary. See also @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbActions000000]{Actions}.

Bonus Actions. If the monster has Bonus Action options, they are listed in this section.

Reactions. If the monster can take special Reactions, those are listed in this section.

Attack Notation. The entry for a monster’s attack starts by identifying whether the attack is a melee or a ranged attack and then provides the attack roll’s bonus, its reach or range, and what happens on a hit. An attack is against one target unless its entry says otherwise.

Saving Throw Effect Notation. If an effect forces a saving throw, the effect’s entry starts by identifying the kind of saving throw required and then provides the save’s DC, a description of which creatures must make the save, and what happens on a failed or a successful save.

Damage Notation. A stat block usually provides both a static number and a die expression for each instance of damage. For example, an attack might deal 4 (1d4 + 2) damage on a hit. The DM determines whether you use the static number or the die expression in parentheses; you don’t use both.
translation:
数据卡包含着一个怪物的游戏数据。每个数据卡都会先写明该怪物的名字，然后呈现以下这些信息。

体型。怪物的体型为微型、小型、中型、大型、巨型或超巨型。另见“体型”。

生物类型。这一栏标记着怪物所属的生灵大家族，以及一些描述性的标签。另见“生物类型 ”。

阵营。此处写明的阵营只是对该怪物阵营的一种建议，由DM决定这个生物的实际阵营为何。另见“阵营”。

护甲等级、先攻以及生命值。这几栏会给予你怪物的护甲等级、先攻与生命值，这些的规则在第1章中均有解释。在生命值右边的括号中写着怪物的生命值骰，以及其体质调整值带来的生命值加成数额（若有）。在先攻调整值右边的括号中写着怪物的先攻定值。有些由法术创造出来的生物缺乏生命骰与先攻相关的信息。

速度。 这里会写明怪物的速度，以及其拥有的各类特殊速度。另见“掘穴速度”、“攀爬速度”、“飞行速度”、“游泳速度”。

属性值。这张表格提供了怪物的属性值、调整值以及豁免检定调整值，所有的这些都在 @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbPlayingTheGam.JournalEntryPage.sIPPXW1mYE3O4xdc]{第 1 章}中均有解释。

技能。这一栏列出了怪物的各项技能熟练（若有）。另见第1章（“ @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbD20Tests00000.JournalEntryPage.zU9fgQbLaVbJvPRX]”）。

抗性与易伤。这两栏列出了怪物的各项抗性与各项易伤（若有）。另见“ &Reference[Resistance] ”与“ @UUID[.bCU0JHnmZsZf1SHp]”。

免疫。这一栏列出了怪物的各项伤害免疫与各项状态免疫（若有）。另见“ @UUID[.vuK6Tth0DFgU74A6]”。

装备。 如果怪物拥有可以给予他人或是被搜刮的装备，其会列在这一栏中。

感官。这一栏列出了怪物的特殊感官（例如黑暗视觉）以及它的被动察觉。另见“ @UUID[.Brc9AnUXBeg0MTX6]”。

语言。 这一栏列出了该怪物知晓的所有语言。

CR. 挑战等级象征着怪物大致的威胁度，在《怪物图鉴》中有所解释。在挑战等级后的是该怪物被击败后角色们所能获得的经验值，以及该怪物的熟练加值。某些由魔法所创造的生物不具有挑战等级。另见“ @UUID[.BMoxmXB8pX6bOBus]”与“ @UUID[.DksBBFbqPY2FCReT]”。

特质。怪物的特质（若有）是每时每刻都生效或是在特定情况下生效的特性。

动作。 怪物不止可以执行术语汇编中写明的动作，还能执行这一段落所写的动作作为补充。另见第1章（“ @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbActions000000]”）。

附赠动作。 如果该怪物具有附赠动作选项，这些选项将会列在这一段落中。

反应。如果怪物可以执行特殊的反应，这些反应也会列在这一段落中。

攻击的格式。 某一栏写的是怪物的攻击，那么该栏将会先定义此次攻击为近战攻击还是远程攻击，然后给予该攻击检定的加值，再是其触及范围或射程，最后是命中时会发生的事。一次攻击只会有一个目标，除非该栏说明其例外。

豁免效应的格式。 如果某个效应要迫使生物进行一次豁免，该效应的那栏会先定义该豁免的类型，然后给予该豁免的DC，再是描述何种生物必须进行这次豁免，最后是在豁免失败/豁免成功时会发生什么。

伤害的格式。 数据卡上的伤害往往会同时给予每个伤害实例一个固定值与一个掷骰表达式。举个例子，一次攻击可能会在命中时造成4（1d4+2）点伤害。由DM决定你使用固定值还是括号内的掷骰表达式，但你不能两者并用。

original: A target is the creature or object targeted by an attack roll, forced to make a saving throw by an effect, or selected to receive the effects of a spell or another phenomenon.
translation: 目标即为：被攻击检定选中的生物/物件；被某效应迫使进行豁免检定的生物/物件；被选来承受法术或其他现象带来效应的生物/物件。

original:
Teleportation is a special kind of magical transportation. If you teleport, you disappear and reappear elsewhere instantly, without moving through the intervening space. This transportation doesn’t expend movement unless a rule tells you otherwise, and teleportation never provokes Opportunity Attacks.

When you teleport, all the equipment you’re wearing and carrying teleports with you. If you’re touching another creature when you teleport, that creature doesn’t teleport with you unless the teleportation effect says otherwise.

If the destination space of your teleportation is occupied by another creature or blocked by a solid obstacle, you instead appear in the nearest unoccupied space of your choice.

The description of a teleportation effect tells you if you must see the teleportation’s destination.
translation:
传送是一种特殊的魔法转移方式。若你进行传送，你会瞬间消失并立即重现在另一处地方，且传送并不会令你途经起点与终点之间的空间。这一转移方式不会消耗你的移动力（除非有规则声明其例外）。传送永远不会引发借机攻击。

当你传送时，所有被你穿着/携带的物品都会跟随着你一起传送。如果你在传送时触碰着某个生物，该生物不会因此随你传送——除非该传送效应声明其例外。

如果你的传送目标空间被另一生物占据，或是被固体障碍物阻挡，你会改为传送至距离该空间最近的一处由你选择的未占据空间内。

如果传送的目的地需要是“你可见的空间”，相应的传送效应的描述会告知你这一点。

key: entries->Appendix C: Rules Glossary->pages->Temporary Hit Points->name
entries->Appendix C: Rules Glossary->pages->Temporary Hit Points->text
original: Temporary Hit Points are granted by certain effects and act as a buffer against losing real @UUID[.sh9GYVdAi8hfH1ru]{Hit Points}. See also @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbDamageAndHeal]{Damage and Healing}.
translation: 临时生命值是由特定效应提供的，效果如同一个可以抵御你实际 @UUID[.sh9GYVdAi8hfH1ru]损失的缓冲层的数值。另见第1章（“@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbDamageAndHeal]”）。

original: A space is unoccupied if no creatures are in it and it isn’t completely filled by objects.
translation: 如果一处空间中既没有生物，也没被物件完全填充满，那么这个空间就是未被占据的。

original: If you have Vulnerability to a damage type, damage of that type is doubled against you. Vulnerability is applied only once to an instance of damage. See also @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbDamageAndHeal]{Damage and Healing}.
translation: 如果你具有某项伤害类型的易伤，你所受的该类型伤害将被加倍。对于每个伤害实例而言，易伤只会生效一次。另见第1章（“ @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbDamageAndHeal]”）。

original: A weapon is an object that is in the Simple or Martial weapon category. See also @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbEquipment0000.JournalEntryPage.dWQ2ZTLOuKr3PMAx]{Weapons}.
translation: 一把武器是一件被分类为简易武器或军用武器的物件。另见第 6 章（“ @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbEquipment0000.JournalEntryPage.dWQ2ZTLOuKr3PMAx]”）。

original: A weapon attack is an attack roll made with a weapon. See also @UUID[.dSMhNOxGIJglsjnX]{Weapon}.
translation: 武器攻击是一次使用武器进行的攻击检定。另见“ @UUID[.dSMhNOxGIJglsjnX]”。

original:
“You.” The game’s rules—in this glossary and elsewhere—often talk about something happening to you in the game world. That “you” refers to the creature or object that the rule applies to in a particular moment of play. For example, the “you” in the Prone condition is a creature that currently has that condition.

No Obsolete Terms. The glossary contains definitions of current rules terms only. If you’re looking for a term from an earlier version of the fifth edition rules, consult the index.

Abbreviations. The abbreviations listed below appear in this glossary and elsewhere in the rules.

AbbreviationMeaning
ACArmor Class
CConcentration
CEChaotic Evil
CGChaotic Good
Cha.Charisma
CNChaotic Neutral
Con.Constitution
CPCopper Piece(s)
CRChallenge Rating
DCDifficulty Class
Dex.Dexterity
DMDungeon Master
EPElectrum Piece(s)
GPGold Piece(s)
HPHit Point(s)
Int.Intelligence
LELawful Evil
LGLawful Good
LNLawful Neutral
MMaterial component
NNeutral
NENeutral Evil
NGNeutral Good
NPCNonplayer character
PBProficiency Bonus
PPPlatinum Piece(s)
RRitual
SSomatic component
SPSilver Piece(s)
Str.Strength
VVerbal component
Wis.Wisdom
XPExperience Point(s)
translation:
你。 游戏规则下——无论是在这个术语表还是其他地方——常常提到游戏世界中发生在“你”身上的事情。这里的“你”指的是在特定游戏时刻适用规则的生物或物体。例如，在倒地状态下的“你”指的是当前处于这种状态的生物。

另见。 一些术语表条目包含“另见”部分，指向术语表中的其他条目、书中的章节，或者两者都有。

无过时术语。 术语表只包含当前版本的规则术语定义。如果你在寻找早期版本的术语，请查阅索引。

缩写。 以下列出的缩写在术语表及规则的其他部分中将会出现：

缩写 含义
AC 护甲等级
C 专注
CE 混乱邪恶
CG 混乱善良
Cha. 魅力
CN 混乱中立
Con. 体质
CP 铜币
CR 挑战等级
DC 困难等级
Dex. 敏捷
DM 地下城主
EP 银金币
GP 金币
HP 生命值
Int. 智力
LE 秩序
LG 秩序善良
LN 秩序中立
M 材料成分
N 绝对中立
NE 中立邪恶
NG 中立善良
NPC 非玩家角色
PB 熟练加值
PP 白金币
R 仪式
S 姿势成分
SP 银币
Str. 力量
V 言语成分
Wis. 感知
XP 经验值

original:
Your size and Strength score determine the maximum weight in pounds that you can carry, as shown in the Carrying Capacity table. The table also shows the maximum weight you can drag, lift, or push.

While dragging, lifting, or pushing weight in excess of the maximum weight you can carry, your Speed can be no more than 5 feet.

Carrying Capacity

Creature Size

Carry

Drag/Lift/Push

Tiny

Strength x 7.5 lb.

Strength x 15 lb.

Small/Medium

Strength x 15 lb.

Strength x 30 lb.

Large

Strength x 30 lb.

Strength x 60 lb.

Huge

Strength x 60 lb.

Strength x 120 lb.

Gargantuan

Strength x 120 lb.

Strength x 240 lb.
translation:
你的体型与力量属性值共同决定了你可以承载的最大重量（单位为磅），如载重表所示的那样。该表同样展示了你可以拖拽、抬起、推动的最大重量。

若你拖拽、抬起、推动的重量超出了你可以承载的最大重量，你的速度将被限制为至高5尺。

original:
When you make a Long Jump, you leap horizontally a number of feet up to your Strength score if you move at least 10 feet immediately before the jump. When you make a standing Long Jump, you can leap only half that distance. Either way, each foot you jump costs a foot of movement.

If you land in &Reference[difficult-terrain], you must succeed on a [[/check 10 acr]] check or have the &Reference[Prone] condition.

This Long Jump rule assumes that the height of the jump doesn’t matter, such as a jump across a stream or chasm. At your DM’s option, you must succeed on a [[/check 10 ath]] check to clear a low obstacle (no taller than a quarter of the jump’s distance), such as a hedge or low wall. Otherwise, you hit the obstacle.
translation:
当你跳远时，如果你徒步移动了至少10尺，之后立即起跳，你可以水平跳出至多等于你力量属性值尺的距离。当你进行立定跳远时，你只能跳到该距离的一半。不论哪种跳远方式，每跳1尺就需要消耗1尺的移动力。

若你在 &Reference[difficult-terrain]中落地，你必须通过一次DC10的 [[/check dc=10 acr]] 检定，否则将陷入 &Reference[prone] 状态。

跳远规则只适用于跳跃高度并不重要的情况，例如跳过一条小溪或裂缝。根据DM的判断，若你要利用跳远跨越低矮的障碍物（例如树篱或矮墙，但其高度至高不能超过本次跳跃距离的四分之一），你必须通过一次 [[/check dc=10 ath]] 检定。若你没能通过检定，你将撞上障碍物。

original:
When you make a High Jump, you leap into the air a number of feet equal to 3 plus your Strength modifier (minimum of 0 feet) if you move at least 10 feet on foot immediately before the jump. When you make a standing High Jump, you can jump only half that distance. Either way, each foot of the jump costs a foot of movement.

You can extend your arms half your height above yourself during the jump. Thus, you can reach a distance equal to the height of the jump plus 1½ times your height.
translation:
当你进行跳高时，如果你徒步移动了至少10尺，之后立即起跳，你可以跳起到离地至高 3 + 你的力量调整值尺的空中（最低0尺）。当你进行立定跳高时，你只能跳到该高度的一半。不论哪种跳高方式，每跳1尺就需要消耗1尺的移动力。

跳跃中，你可以伸展自己的手臂来触及比你自己高半个身高的地方。因此，此时你可以触及到的距离等于你跳跃的高度+1½倍你的身高。

original: An attack roll is a &Reference[D20 Test] that represents making an attack with a weapon, an Unarmed Strike, or a spell.
translation: 攻击检定即是使用某把武器、某次徒手打击或某道法术发动的攻击所进行的 &Reference[D20 Test] 检定。

original: Armor training allows you to use armor of a certain category without the following drawbacks. If you wear Light, Medium, or Heavy armor and lack training with it, you have &Reference[disadvantage] on any &Reference[D20 Test] that involves Strength or Dexterity, and you can’t cast spells. If you use a Shield and lack training with it, you don’t gain its AC bonus. See also @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbEquipment0000.JournalEntryPage.flJnTPWIwTrAzqTi]{Armor}.
translation:
拥有某一类的护甲受训可以使你在穿着这一类护甲时不会受到下述的这些惩罚。

若你着装一套轻甲、中甲或重甲且不具有其的受训，你进行的任何基于力量与敏捷的 &Reference[D20 Test] 检定都会具有 &Reference[disadvantage] ，且你无法施展法术。如果你使用一面盾牌且不具有其的受训，你无法获得该盾牌提供的AC加值。另见 “@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbEquipment0000.JournalEntryPage.flJnTPWIwTrAzqTi]”。

original:
An Armor Class (AC) is the target number for an attack roll. AC represents how difficult it is to hit a target.

Your base AC calculation is 10 plus your Dexterity modifier. If a rule gives you another base AC calculation, you choose which calculation to use; you can’t use more than one. See also @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbPlayingTheGam]{Attack Roll}.
translation:
护甲等级（AC）是一次攻击检定的目标数值。目标的AC代表着击中该目标的难度。

你的基础AC算法是 10 + 你的敏捷调整值。如果规则给予你另一个基础AC算法，你可以选择使用哪个算法，但你无法同时使用多于一个的算法。另见 “@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbAppendixCRule.JournalEntryPage.W8uJrd1D8NeOuawp]”。

original: Some magic items require a creature to form a bond—called Attunement—with them before the creature can use an item’s magical properties. A creature can have Attunement with no more than three magic items at a time. See also @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbMagicItems000]{Magic Items}.
translation: 有些魔法物品需要生物与之进行“绑定”——其被称为同调——才能使用这些物品的魔法属性。一个生物在同一时间可以维持至多三个魔法物品的同调。另见 “@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbMagicItems000]”。

original: A creature is Bloodied while it has half its Hit Points or fewer remaining.
translation: 在一名生物具有的生命值只有一半或不足一半期间，其处于浴血。

original:
Objects can be harmed by attacks and by some spells, using the rules below. If an object is exceedingly fragile, the DM may allow a creature to break it automatically with the @UUID[.f4fZHwBvpbpzRyn4]{Attack} or @UUID[.UDlogfdiT2uYEZz4]{Utilize} action.

To track Hit Points for a Huge or Gargantuan object, divide it into Large or smaller sections, and track each section’s Hit Points separately. The DM determines whether destroying part of an object causes the whole thing to collapse.

Damage Types and Objects. Objects have Immunity to Poison and Psychic damage. The DM might decide that some damage types are more or less effective against an object. For example, Bludgeoning damage works well for smashing things but not for cutting. Paper or cloth objects might have Vulnerability to Fire damage.

No Ability Scores. An object lacks ability scores unless a rule assigns scores to the object. Without ability scores, an object can’t make ability checks, and it fails all saving throws.
translation:
各种攻击都可以伤害到物件，一部分法术也可以伤害到物件。如果一个物件过于脆弱，DM也许会允许在生物对其使用@UUID[.f4fZHwBvpbpzRyn4] 或 @UUID[.UDlogfdiT2uYEZz4] 动作。

与伤害类型的互动。 物件具有毒素伤害免疫与心灵伤害免疫。DM也许会判定某些伤害类型对某物件具有更好/更差的效果。举个例子，钝击伤害在击碎各种物品时非常好用，但在裁剪物品时效果就不尽人意。纸质或布质的物件可能具有火焰伤害易伤。

无属性值。 只要规则没有为一个物件设定属性，物件通常是不具有属性值的。因为没有属性值，物件无法进行属性检定，且会自动失败于一切豁免检定。

original: A campaign is a series of adventures. See also @UUID[.e3DmlL7JEghucu8V]{Adventure}.
translation: 一场战役由一系列的冒险组成。另见 “@UUID[.e3DmlL7JEghucu8V]”。

original: Challenge Rating (CR) summarizes the threat a monster poses to a group of four player characters. Compare a monster’s CR to the characters’ level. If the CR is higher, the monster is likely a danger. If the CR is lower, the monster likely poses little threat. But circumstances and the number of player characters can significantly alter how threatening a monster is in actual play. The Dungeon Master’s Guide provides guidance to the DM on using CR while planning potential combat encounters. See also @UUID[.St3ANvrKOgxECnTn]{Stat Block}.
translation: 挑战等级（CR）是对怪物面对四个玩家角色时的威胁度评估。对比怪物的CR与角色们的等级。如果CR更高，这个怪物可能就更具危险。如果CR更低，这个怪物可能造成不了多大的威胁。在实际游戏中，玩家的数量以及各种各样的情况都可能导致怪物的威胁度发生变化。《地下城主指南》中为DM提供了使用CR设计遭遇战的指导。另见 “@UUID[.St3ANvrKOgxECnTn]”。

original: A character sheet is a paper or digital record that you use to track your character’s information. See also @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbCreatingAChar]{chapter 2}.
translation: 角色卡指的是记载有你角色各项信息的一张纸或电子记录，你需要使用你的角色卡来追踪你角色的各项信息。另见 “@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbCreatingAChar]{第 2 章}”。

original: If you (a player character) have Heroic Inspiration, you can expend it to reroll any die immediately after rolling it, and you must use the new roll. If you gain Heroic Inspiration but already have it, it’s lost unless you give it to a player character who lacks it.
translation: 如果你（一名玩家角色）拥有英雄激励，你可以在投掷任何骰子后，消耗激励来重骰它。但你必须选用新的投掷结果。获得新的英雄激励时，如果你已有英雄激励，该英雄激励消失，除非你将其给予另一个没有英雄激励的玩家角色。

original:
In situations where keeping track of the passage of time is important, the GM determines the time a task requires. The GM might use a different time scale depending on the context of the situation at hand. In a dungeon environment, the adventurers' movement happens on a scale of minutes. It takes them about a minute to creep down a long hallway, another minute to check for traps on the door at the end of the hall, and a good ten minutes to search the chamber beyond for anything interesting or valuable.

In a city or wilderness, a scale of hours is often more appropriate. Adventurers eager to reach the lonely tower at the heart of the forest hurry across those fifteen miles in just under four hours' time.

For long journeys, a scale of days works best. Following the road from Baldur's Gate to Waterdeep, the adventurers spend four uneventful days before a goblin ambush interrupts their journey.

In combat and other fast-paced situations, the game relies on rounds, a 6-second span of time.
translation:
在战斗之外，GM根据情况需要决定时间的流逝速度，分钟用于探索地下城或闯入房屋，小时用于穿越城市或荒野，天用于世界中的长途旅行。

在战斗和其他快节奏的情况下，游戏依赖于轮，每轮时间为6秒。

original:
Outside of combat, the GM determines how fast time passes depending on what the situation requires, minutes for exploring a dungeon or breaking into a house, hours for traveling through a city or through the wilderness, or days for long journeys through the world.

During combat and other fast-paced situations, the game relies on rounds, a 6-second span of time.
translation:
有时候，DM需要在事件与时间轴密切关联时决定其需时长短。DM可以视眼前的状况来决定使用什么时间单位作为度量。在地下城里，冒险者以 分钟为单位进行移动。穿越一条长廊约需一分钟，检查位于大厅末端的门有没有陷阱又要花一分钟，而寻找后面的房间有没有值钱或有趣的东西要花足足十分钟。

在城市或野外，通常用 小时 会比较适合。想去林中孤塔的冒险者可以在四小时内赶完十五里的路。

长途旅程可以用 天 计算。从博德之门到深水城，冒险者们渡过安然无恙的四日后，旅程却被地精的埋伏打断。

 战斗和其他高速转变的环境，则以 轮 来推动游戏进展，每轮时间等同于6秒。

original:
A creature has a Speed, which is the distance in feet the creature can cover when it moves on its turn. See also @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbAppendixCRule.JournalEntryPage.a4CjDIEMeSbRaEjA]{Climbing}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbAppendixCRule.JournalEntryPage.zRZl7vdjzjqpazxn]{Crawling}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbAppendixCRule.JournalEntryPage.ozHhbP8JVHCJAx0b]{Flying}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbAppendixCRule.JournalEntryPage.aaJOlRhI1H6vAxt9]{Jumping}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbAppendixCRule.JournalEntryPage.53c9JMqckHagYYB5]{Swimming}.

Burrow

A creature that has a Burrow Speed can use that speed to move through sand, earth, mud, or ice. The creature can’t burrow through solid rock unless the creature has a trait that allows it to do so.

Climb

A Climb Speed can be used in place of Speed to traverse a vertical surface without expending the extra movement normally associated with climbing.

Fly

A Fly Speed can be used to travel through the air. While you have a Fly Speed, you can stay aloft until you land, fall, or die.

Swim

A Swim Speed can be used to swim without expending the extra movement normally associated with swimming.
translation:
生物拥有着速度，一个代表着其在自己回合中可以跨过多少距离的数值，单位为尺。另见 @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbAppendixCRule.JournalEntryPage.a4CjDIEMeSbRaEjA], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbAppendixCRule.JournalEntryPage.zRZl7vdjzjqpazxn], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbAppendixCRule.JournalEntryPage.aaJOlRhI1H6vAxt9], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbAppendixCRule.JournalEntryPage.53c9JMqckHagYYB5]。

特殊速度。 有些生物拥有特殊速度，例如掘穴速度、攀爬速度、飞行速度、游泳速度（这些速度在术语汇编中均有释义）。如果你拥有超过一种速度，在你移动时你需要选择使用其中的哪个速度，且你可以在移动中更换你所用的速度。

每当你更换速度时，你需要计算新的速度减去你已移动的距离的结果，计算结果决定了在新速度下你还能移动多少距离。如果计算结果为0或者更低，你本次移动将无法使用该新速度。举个例子，如果你有拥有30尺的速度与40尺的飞行速度，你可以先飞行10尺，然后走10尺，最后升到空中再飞20尺。

速度上的变化。 如果某个效应在一段时间增加或减少了你的速度，在那期间内，你拥有的所有特殊速度都会相应地进行加减。举个例子，若你拥有攀爬速度，当你的速度被降至0时，你的攀爬速度也会同样地被降至零。同样的，若你拥有飞行速度，当你的速度被减半时，你的飞行速度也会被减半。

original:
While traveling outside combat, a group can move at a Fast, Normal, or Slow pace, as shown on the Travel Pace table. The table states how far the party can move in a period of time; if riding horses or other mounts, the group can move twice that distance for 1 hour, after which the mounts need a &Reference[Short Rest]{Short} or &Reference[Long Rest] before they can move at that increased pace again (see @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbMountsAndVehi.JournalEntryPage.NVPIUDJEdFDaErTg]{chapter 6} for a selection of mounts for sale). The Dungeon Master’s Guide has rules that affect which pace you can choose in certain types of terrain.

在战斗外旅行时，一个团队可以以快速、正常或慢速行进，如行进速度表所示。表格规定了团队在一定时间内可以移动的距离；如果骑马或其他坐骑， 团队可以在1小时内移动两倍的距离，之后坐骑需要 &Reference[Short Rest] 或 &Reference[Long Rest]才能再次以这种更快的速度移动（见 @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbMountsAndVehi.JournalEntryPage.NVPIUDJEdFDaErTg]{第 6 章} 关于坐骑的出售选择）。地下城主指南有规定受某些特定地形影响时可以选择哪种步调。

original: If a space is Difficult Terrain, every foot of movement in that space costs 1 extra foot. For example, moving 5 feet through Difficult Terrain costs 10 feet of movement. Difficult Terrain isn’t cumulative; either a space is Difficult Terrain or it isn’t.
translation: 如果一处空间是困难地形，那么在这个空间里进行的每尺移动都需要额外消耗1尺移动力。举个例子，移动穿过5尺的困难地形需要消耗你10尺的移动力。困难地形无法叠加，一处空间只可能“是困难地形”或“不是困难地形”。

key: entries->Appendix D: Rule References->pages->Climbing, Swimming, and Crawling->name
entries->Appendix D: Rule References->pages->Climbing, Swimming, and Crawling->text
original:
While climbing or swimming, each foot of movement costs 1 extra foot (2 extra feet in difficult terrain), unless a creature has a climbing or swimming speed.

At the DM’s option, moving any distance in rough water or climbing a slippery surface or one with few handholds might require a successful [[/check dc=15 ath]] check.
translation:
在你匍匐、游泳、攀爬期间，你每移动1尺需要额外消耗1尺移动力（在困难地形下为额外2尺）。

根据DM的判断，攀爬上一个光滑的表面或是没有多少可抓握位置的表面也许需要你成功通过一次[[/check dc=15 ath]] 检定。

original:
Long Jump. When you make a Long Jump, you leap horizontally a number of feet up to your Strength score if you move at least 10 feet immediately before the jump. When you make a standing Long Jump, you can leap only half that distance. Either way, each foot you jump costs a foot of movement.

If you land in &Reference[difficult-terrain], you must succeed on a [[/check dc=10 acr]] check or have the &Reference[prone] condition.

This Long Jump rule assumes that the height of the jump doesn’t matter, such as a jump across a stream or chasm. At your DM’s option, you must succeed on a [[/check dc=10 ath]] check to clear a low obstacle (no taller than a quarter of the jump’s distance), such as a hedge or low wall. Otherwise, you hit the obstacle.
translation:
跳远。 当你跳远时，如果你徒步移动了至少10尺，之后立即起跳，你可以水平跳出至多等于你力量属性值尺的距离。当你进行立定跳远时，你只能跳到该距离的一半。不论哪种跳远方式，每跳1尺就需要消耗1尺的移动力。

若你在 &Reference[difficult-terrain]中落地，你必须通过一次DC10的 [[/check dc=10 acr]] 检定，否则将陷入 &Reference[prone] 状态。

跳远规则只适用于跳跃高度并不重要的情况，例如跳过一条小溪或裂缝。根据DM的判断，若你要利用跳远跨越低矮的障碍物（例如树篱或矮墙，但其高度至高不能超过本次跳跃距离的四分之一），你必须通过一次 [[/check dc=10 ath]] 检定。若你没能通过检定，你将撞上障碍物。

original:
High Jump. When you make a High Jump, you leap into the air a number of feet equal to 3 plus your Strength modifier (minimum of 0 feet) if you move at least 10 feet on foot immediately before the jump. When you make a standing High Jump, you can jump only half that distance. Either way, each foot of the jump costs a foot of movement.

You can extend your arms half your height above yourself during the jump. Thus, you can reach a distance equal to the height of the jump plus 1½ times your height.
translation:
跳高。 当你进行跳高时，如果你徒步移动了至少10尺，之后立即起跳，你可以跳起到离地至高3+你的力量调整值尺的空中（最低0尺）。当你进行立定跳高时，你只能跳到该高度的一半。不论哪种跳高方式，每跳1尺就需要消耗1尺的移动力。

跳跃中，你可以伸展自己的手臂来触及比你自己高半个身高的地方。因此，此时你可以触及到的距离等于你跳跃的高度+1½倍你的身高。

original:
A creature that falls takes [[/damage 1d6 type=bludgeoning]] damage at the end of the fall for every 10 feet it fell, to a maximum of [[/damage 20d6 type=bludgeoning]] damage. When the creature lands, it has the &Reference[Prone] condition unless it avoids taking any damage from the fall.

A creature that falls into water or another liquid can use its &Reference[Reaction] to make a [[/check dc=15 ath]] or [[/check dc=15 acr]] check to hit the surface head or feet first. On a successful check, any damage resulting from the fall is halved.
translation:
在一次坠落结束时，你每坠落10尺就会受到 [[/damage 1d6 type=bludgeoning]] 钝击伤害，最大值为 [[/damage 20d6 type=bludgeoning]] 。同时你会以倒地状态着陆，除非你以某种方式避免了坠落伤害。这里有两个可选项，用以扩展这条简单粗暴的规则。

一个生物在落入水中或其他液体中时，可以使用其 &Reference[Reaction] 进行一次 [[/check dc=15 ath]] 或 [[/check dc=15 acr]] 检定，来让头或脚先入水。若检定成功，任何由坠落造成的伤害都会减半。

original: A creature can hold its breath for a number of minutes equal to 1 plus its Constitution modifier (minimum of 30 seconds) before suffocation begins. When a creature runs out of breath or is choking, it gains 1 &Reference[Exhaustion] level at the end of each of its turns. When a creature can breathe again, it removes all levels of Exhaustion it gained from suffocating.
translation: 生物可以闭气的时间分钟数等于1加上其体质调整值（至少30秒），然后才会开始窒息。当生物失去空气或窒息时，它在其每个回合结束时获得1级 &Reference[Exhaustion]。当生物可以再次呼吸时，它会移除因窒息获得的所有等级。

Some adventuring tasks—such as noticing danger, hitting an enemy, and targeting certain spells—are affected by sight, so effects that obscure vision can hinder you, as explained below.

冒险中，有很多行动会受到视野的影响——例如察觉危险、攻击敌人、法术瞄准，因此阻挡视野的效应可能会阻碍你，具体规则如下。

original: In a lightly obscured area, such as dim light, patchy fog, or moderate foliage, creatures have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
translation: 在你正尝试去看某个处于轻度遮蔽下的事物期间，你进行的感知（察觉）检定具有劣势。

original: A heavily obscured area—such as darkness, opaque fog, or dense foliage—blocks vision entirely. A creature effectively suffers from the &Reference[condition=blinded] condition when trying to see something in that area.
translation: 处于重度遮蔽的空间——例如黑暗、浓雾、浓密的植物覆盖等——会完全阻隔视觉。生物尝试去看处于受重度遮蔽中的事物时，其等同于处于 &Reference[condition=blinded] 状态。

original: Bright light lets most creatures see normally. Even gloomy days provide bright light, as do torches, lanterns, fires, and other sources of illumination within a specific radius.
translation: 明亮光照明亮光照足够使绝大部分生物正常视物。白昼能提供明亮光照，即便阴天也是如此。一些其他光源——例如火把、提灯、火焰等光源，在一定范围内也同样可以提供明亮光照。

original: Dim light, also called shadows, creates a &Reference[lightly obscured] area. An area of dim light is usually a boundary between a source of bright light, such as a torch, and surrounding darkness. The soft light of twilight and dawn also counts as dim light. A particularly brilliant full moon might bathe the land in dim light.
translation: 微光光照，也就是阴影，会形成 &Reference[lightly obscured] 区域。明亮光照与黑暗之间的交界处通常处于微光光照。黎明或黄昏时的轻柔天光也是微光光照。被满月的月光笼罩的大地也可能处在微光光照之中。

original: Darkness creates a &Reference[heavily-obscured] area. Characters face darkness outdoors at night (even most moonlit nights), within the confines of an unlit dungeon or a subterranean vault, or in an area of magical darkness.
translation: 黑暗 造成一片&Reference[heavily-obscured]区域。角色在以下情况下会面对黑暗：夜晚户外（哪怕是月光最明亮的夜晚），在未点灯的地牢或地下金库中，或者在魔法黑暗区域。

original: If you have Blindsight, you can see within a specific range without relying on physical sight. Within that range, you can see anything that isn't behind &Reference[Total Cover] even if you have the &Reference[Blinded] condition or are in &Reference[Darkness]. Moreover, in that range, you can see something has the Invisible condition.
translation: 果你具有盲视，你可以不依赖物理视觉去看见特定范围内的事物。在该范围内，你可以看见任何事物（除非该事物对你而言处于 &Reference[Total Cover] 下），即使你陷入&Reference[Blinded] 状态期间或在 &Reference[Darkness] 中也是如此。不仅如此，你还可以依此看见范围内的那些具有隐形状态的事物。

original: If you have Darkvision, you can see in &Reference[Dim Light] within a specified range as if it were Bright Light and in &Reference[Darkness] within that range as if it were Dim Light. You discern colors in that Darkness only as shades of gray. See also @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbExploration00]{Exploration}.
translation: 如果你具有黑暗视觉，对你而言，你可以将特定范围内的 &Reference[Dim Light] 视为明亮光照，同样范围内的 &Reference[Darkness] 视为微光光照，不过你无法分辨黑暗中的颜色，只能看到灰度的景象。另见第1章 “@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbExploration00]”。

original:
If you have Truesight, your vision is enhanced within a specified range. Within that range, your vision pierces through the following:

Darkness. You can see in normal and magical &Reference[darkness].

Invisibility. You see creatures and objects that have the &Reference[invisible] condition.

Visual Illusions. Visual illusions appear transparent to you, and you automatically succeed on saving throws against them.

Transformations. You discern the true form of any creature or object you see that has been transformed by magic.

Ethereal Plane. You see into the Ethereal Plane. See also appendix A ("Transitive Planes").
translation:
若你拥有真实视觉，你在特定范围内的视觉能力将被强化。在真实视觉范围内，你的视野将可以“看破”以下这些事物：

黑暗。 你可以看穿黑暗，不论其是普通黑暗还是魔法 &Reference[darkness]。

隐形。 你可以看见具有 &Reference[invisible apply=false] 状态的生物及物件。

视觉幻象。 你眼中的视觉幻象将变成透明的，且你自动通过于对抗这些幻象的豁免。

变化。 你能看出任何你所见的、被魔法变化为另一形态的生物/物件的真实形态。

以太位面。 你可以看到以太位面上的事物。另见附录A（“中转位面”）。

original:
A Short Rest is a 1-hour period of downtime, during which a creature does nothing more strenuous than reading, talking, eating, or standing watch. To start a Short Rest, you must have at least 1 Hit Point.

Benefits of the Rest. When you finish the rest, you gain the following benefits:

Spend Hit Point Dice. You can spend one or more of your Hit Point Dice to regain Hit Points. For each Hit Point Die you spend in this way, roll the die and add your Constitution modifier to it. You regain Hit Points equal to the total (minimum of 1 Hit Point). You can decide to spend an additional Hit Point Die after each roll.

Special Feature. Some features are recharged by a Short Rest. If you have such a feature, it recharges in the way specified in its description.

Interrupting the Rest. A Short Rest is stopped by the following interruptions:

  • Rolling Initiative
  • Casting a spell other than a cantrip
  • Taking any damage

An interrupted Short Rest confers no benefits.
translation:
短休是一段1小时长的休整期，在这期间，生物不能做任何比阅读、交谈、进食或站岗更费力的事情。你必须具有至少1点生命值才能开始一次短休。

短休的增益。 当你完成短休时，你将获得以下这些增益：

消耗生命值骰。 你可以消耗你的一颗或更多生命值骰以恢复生命值。你投掷任意枚生命骰，并加上等于你投掷次数倍的体质调整值。你恢复的生命值等于所掷生命值骰的骰点总数（至少1）。你可以在每次投掷后再决定是否要额外消耗一枚生命值骰。

特殊特性。 有些特性会在短休时恢复使用次数。如果你拥有此类特性，在短休完成时这些特性会以其描述中写明的方式恢复。

打断短休。 一次短休会因下列原因而被打断：

  • 投掷先攻
  • 施展一道非戏法的法术
  • 受到任何伤害

一次被打断的短休不会提供任何增益。

original:
A Long Rest is a period of extended downtime—at least 8 hours—available to any creature. During a Long Rest, you sleep for at least 6 hours and perform no more than 2 hours of light activity, such as reading, talking, eating, or standing watch.

During sleep, you have the Unconscious condition. After you finish a Long Rest, you must wait at least 16 hours before starting another one.

Benefits of the Rest. To start a Long Rest, you must have at least 1 Hit Point. When you finish the rest, you gain the following benefits:

Regain All HP. You regain all lost Hit Points and all spent Hit Point Dice. If your Hit Point maximum was reduced, it returns to normal.

Ability Scores Restored. If any of your ability scores were reduced, they return to normal.

Exhaustion Reduced. If you have the Exhaustion condition, its level decreases by 1.

Special Feature. Some features are recharged by a Long Rest. If you have such a feature, it recharges in the way specified in its description.

Interrupting the Rest. A Long Rest is stopped by the following interruptions:

  • Rolling Initiative
  • Casting a spell other than a cantrip
  • Taking any damage
  • 1 hour of walking or other physical exertion

If you rested at least 1 hour before the interruption, you gain the benefits of a @UUID[.wVuNbEADtC16ejAi]{Short Rest}.

You can resume a Long Rest immediately after an interruption. If you do so, the rest requires 1 additional hour per interruption to finish.
translation:
长休指的是一段长时间的休整期（至少8小时），任何生物都可以进行长休。在一次长休期间，你进行至少6小时的睡眠，并进行至多2小时的轻度活动，例如阅读、交谈、进食或站岗。

睡眠期间，你陷入昏迷状态。完成一次长休后，你必须等待至少16小时后才能开始另一次长休。

长休的增益。 你必须具有至少1点生命值才能开始一次长休，当你完成长休时，你将获得以下这些增益：

恢复全部生命值。 你恢复所有已损失的生命值并重获所有已消耗的生命值骰。如果你的生命值上限被减少了，那么其在此时也会恢复原状。

属性值恢复。 如果你的某项属性值被减少了，那么其在此时会恢复原状。

力竭消退。 如果你具有力竭等级，你的力竭等级减少1级。

特殊特性。 有些特性会在长休时恢复。如果你拥有此类特性，长休完成时这些特性会以它们自己描述中写明的方式恢复。

打断长休 。 一次长休会因下列原因而被打断：

  • 投掷先攻
  • 施展一道非戏法的法术
  • 受到任何伤害

  • 1小时的行走或其他的体力劳动

如果你在长休被打断之前休息了至少1小时，你可以获得一次短休的增益。另见 “@UUID[.wVuNbEADtC16ejAi]{短休}”。

你可以在被打断后立刻继续你的长休，但为了完成这次长休，每被打断一次你就需要额外休息1小时。

original:
There are two ways for a character to rest:

  • &Reference[short rest]

  • &Reference[long rest]
translation:
角色有两种休息方式：

  • &Reference[short rest]

  • &Reference[long rest]

entries->Appendix D: Rule References->pages->Push, Drag, or Lift->text
original: While dragging, lifting, or pushing weight in excess of the maximum weight you can carry, your Speed can be no more than 5 feet.
translation: 推、拉、抬。你可以推、拉、抬起你双倍载重的重量（即 30 倍力量值）。当你推拉高于载重的东西时，你的速度减到 5 尺。

key: entries->Appendix D: Rule References->pages->Size and Strength->name
entries->Appendix D: Rule References->pages->Size and Strength->text
original: Size and Strength. Larger creatures can bear more weight, whereas Tiny creatures can carry less. For each size category above Medium, double the creature's carrying capacity and the amount it can push, drag, or lift. For a Tiny creature, halve these weights.
translation: 体型与力量。 生物体型越大能承载的重量也越高，而微型生物的载重则较小。比中型体型更大的生物其体型每增加一级，负重值和推拉抬极限也随之翻一倍。微型体型生物的该重量值则都减半。

original: Examples: Jump farther than normal, stay afloat in rough water, or break something.
translation: 适用示例：比平时跳的更远，在汹涌的水面上漂浮或是打碎什么东西。

original: If you carry weight in excess of 10 times your Strength score, up to your maximum carrying capacity, you are instead heavily encumbered, which means your speed drops by 20 feet and you have disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws that use Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution.
translation: 当承载大于10倍自身力量值的重量时，你将进入 超载 状态，此时你的速度减少20尺，并且你的力量、敏捷、体质相关的属性检定、攻击检定、豁免检定都将具有劣势。

original:
Dexterity measures agility, reflexes, and balance.

Dexterity Checks
