original: Exploration involves delving into places that are dangerous and full of mystery. The rules in this section detail some of the ways adventurers interact with the environment in such places.
translation: 探索包括深入那些危险且充满神秘的地方。本节的规则详细介绍了冒险者在此类地方与环境互动的一些方式。

original:
As adventurers explore, their equipment can help them in many ways. For example, they can reach out-of-the-way places with a Ladder, perceive things they wouldn’t otherwise notice with a Torch or another light source, bypass locked doors and containers with Thieves’ Tools, and create obstacles for pursuers with Caltrops.

See @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbEquipment0000]{chapter 6} for rules on many items that are useful on adventures. The items in that chapter’s @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbEquipment0000.JournalEntryPage.MK3tMrY7pZgPQZo8]{Tools} and @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbEquipment0000.JournalEntryPage.fWDbFyRcjabZV9lW]{Adventuring Gear} sections are especially useful. The weapons in that chapter can also be used for more than battle; you could use a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbwepQuartersta]{Quarterstaff}, for example, to push a sinister-looking button that you’re reluctant to touch.
translation:
当冒险者探索时，他们的装备可以在许多方面帮助他们。例如，他们可以使用梯子到达难以接近的地方，使用火把或其他光源察觉他们原本不会注意到的事物，使用盗贼工具绕过锁着的门和容器，以及使用刺钉为追赶者制造障碍。

关于许多在冒险中有用的物品的规则，请参阅 @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbEquipment0000]{第 6 章} 。该章中的 @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbEquipment0000.JournalEntryPage.MK3tMrY7pZgPQZo8]{工具} 和 @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbEquipment0000.JournalEntryPage.fWDbFyRcjabZV9lW]{ 冒险用品} 部分的物品特别有用。那一章中的武器也可以用于战斗之外的目的；例如，你可以使用 @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbwepQuartersta] 来推按一个你不愿意直接触摸的阴森按钮。

original:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbCh1ArtHandout.JournalEntryPage.678vnBXr3wCQ8onH classes="right two" caption=false cite=false]

Some adventuring tasks—such as noticing danger, hitting an enemy, and targeting certain spells—are affected by sight, so effects that obscure vision can hinder you, as explained below.

Obscured Areas

An area might be &Reference[Lightly Obscured] or &Reference[Heavily Obscured]. In a Lightly Obscured area—such as an area with &Reference[Dim Light], patchy fog, or moderate foliage—you have &Reference[Disadvantage] on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

A Heavily Obscured area—such as an area with &Reference[Darkness], heavy fog, or dense foliage—is opaque. You have the &Reference[Blinded] condition when trying to see something there.

Light

The presence or absence of light determines the category of illumination in an area, as defined below.

Bright Light. Bright Light lets most creatures see normally. Even gloomy days provide Bright Light, as do torches, lanterns, fires, and other sources of illumination within a specific radius.

Dim Light. Dim Light, also called shadows, creates a &Reference[Lightly Obscured] area. An area of Dim Light is usually a boundary between Bright Light and surrounding Darkness. The soft light of twilight and dawn also counts as Dim Light. A full moon might bathe the land in Dim Light.

Darkness. Darkness creates a &Reference[Heavily Obscured] area. Characters face Darkness outdoors at night (even most moonlit nights), within the confines of an unlit dungeon, or in an area of magical Darkness.

Special Senses

Some creatures have special senses that help them perceive things in certain situations. The rules glossary defines the following special senses:

  • &Reference[Blindsight]

  • &Reference[Darkvision]

  • &Reference[Tremorsense]

  • &Reference[Truesight]
translation:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbCh1ArtHandout.JournalEntryPage.678vnBXr3wCQ8onH classes="right two" caption=false cite=false]

一些冒险任务会受视线的影响，例如注意到危险、攻击敌人和标定特定法术，因此影响视觉的效果会阻碍你，如下所述。

遮蔽区域

一个区域可能是 &Reference[Lightly Obscured] 或 &Referencee[heavilyobscured]。在轻度遮蔽的区域——例如有 &Reference[Dim Light]、零星雾气或适度植被的区域——你在依赖视觉的感知（察觉）检定上有 &Reference[Disadvantage]。

重度遮蔽的区域——例如有 &Reference[Darkness]、浓雾或密集植被的区域——是不透明的。当你试图在那里看见某物时，你有 &Reference[Blinded] 状态（见规则术语表）。

光线

光线的存在或缺失决定了一个区域内的照明类别， 如下所定义。

明亮光照。 明亮光照让大多数生物能够正常看见。即使是阴沉的日子也提供明亮光照，火把、灯笼、火焰以及其他特定半径内的光源也是如此。

微光光照。 微光光照，也称为阴影，创建一个轻度遮蔽的区域。微光光照区域通常是光明和周围黑暗之间的边界。黄昏和黎明的柔和光线也被视为微光光照。满月可能会将大地沐浴在微光光照之中。黄昏和黎明的柔和光线也被视为微光光照。满月可能会将大地沐浴在微光光照之中。

黑暗。 黑暗创建一个重度视线受阻的区域。角色在夜间（即使是大多数月光照耀的夜晚）户外、未点亮的地下城中，或在魔法黑暗区域中都会面临黑暗。

特殊感官

一些生物拥有特殊的感官，帮助它们在某些情况下感知事物。规则术语表定义了以下特殊感官：

  • &Reference[Blindsight]

  • &Reference[Darkvision]

  • @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbAppendixCRule.JournalEntryPage.r64UrNusMhwJVnxb]

  • &Reference[Truesight]

original: Adventurers and monsters often hide, whether to spy on one another, sneak past a guardian, or set an ambush. The Dungeon Master decides when circumstances are appropriate for hiding. When you try to hide, you take the &Reference[Hide] action.
translation: 冒险者和怪物会经常躲藏，无论是为了相互监视、偷偷经过守护者，还是设下伏击。DM决定何时的情境适合躲藏。当你尝试躲藏时，你执行 &Reference[Hide] 动作。

original:
Interacting with objects is often simple to resolve. The player tells the DM that their character is doing something, such as moving a lever or opening a door, and the DM describes what happens. Sometimes, however, rules govern what you can do with an object, as detailed in the following sections.

What Is an Object?

For the purpose of the rules, an object is a discrete, inanimate item like a window, door, sword, book, table, chair, or stone. It isn’t a building or a vehicle, which are composed of many objects.

Time-Limited Object Interactions

When time is short, such as in combat, interactions with objects are limited: one free interaction per turn. That interaction must occur during a creature’s movement or action. Any additional interactions require the &Reference[Utilize] action, as explained in @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbCombat0000000]{Combat} later in this chapter.

Finding Hidden Objects

When your character searches for hidden things, such as a secret door or a trap, the DM typically asks you to make a Wisdom (Perception) check, provided you describe the character searching in the hidden object’s vicinity. On a success, you find the object, other important details, or both.

If you describe your character searching nowhere near a hidden object, a Wisdom (Perception) check won’t reveal the object, no matter the check’s total.

Carrying Objects

You can usually carry your gear and treasure without worrying about the weight of those objects. If you try to haul an unusually heavy object or a massive number of lighter objects, the DM might require you to abide by the rules for &Reference[carrying capacity].

Breaking Objects

As an action, you can automatically break or otherwise destroy a fragile, nonmagical object, such as a glass container or a piece of paper. If you try to damage something more resilient, the DM might use the rules on &Reference[breaking objects] in the rules glossary.
translation:
与物件交互通常很容易解决。玩家告诉DM他们的角色正在做什么，例如移动杠杆或打开门，然后DM描述发生了什么。然而，有时规则会规定你可以用物件做什么，如下文所详述。

什么是物件？

就规则而言，物件是一个离散的、无生命的物品， 如窗户、门、剑、书、桌子、椅子或石头。它不是建筑物或车辆，这些由许多物件组成的东西。

时间限制的物件交互

当时间紧迫时，例如在战斗中，与物件的交互是有限的：每回合一次免费交互。这种交互必须在生物移动或动作期间进行。任何额外的交互都需要使用“使用”动作，如本章后面“@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbCombat0000000] ”中所解释的。

寻找躲藏的物件

当你的角色搜索躲藏的东西时，例如一个秘密门或陷阱，DM通常会要求你进行感知（察觉）检定， 前提是你描述的角色在躲藏物件的附近搜索。如果成功，你会找到物件、其他重要细节或两者都有。

如果你描述的角色在远离躲藏物体的地方搜索， 无论检定的总值如何，感知（察觉）检定都不会揭示该物件。

携带物件

你通常可以携带你的装备和财宝，而不用担心这些物件的重量。如果你试图搬运一个异常重的物件或大量较轻的物件，DM可能会要求你遵守规则术语表中的 &Reference[carrying capacity] 规则。

破坏物件

作为一个动作，你可以自动破坏或以其他方式摧毁一个易碎的、非魔法物件，如玻璃容器或一张纸。如果你试图伤害更坚韧的东西，DM可能会使用规则术语表中关于 &Reference[breaking objects] 的规则。

original:
Monsters are the main perils characters face, but other dangers await. The rules glossary defines the following &Reference[hazards]:

  • &Reference[Burning]

  • &Reference[Dehydration]

  • &Reference[Falling]

  • &Reference[Malnutrition]

  • &Reference[Suffocation]

Burning

translation:
怪物是角色面临的主要危险，但还有其他危险在等待。规则术语表定义了以下&Reference[hazards]：

  • &Reference[Burning]

  • &Reference[Dehydration]

  • @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbAppendixCRule.JournalEntryPage.lCwPWK4ODxw2IV1x]

original:
During an adventure, the characters might travel long distances on trips that could take hours or days. The DM can summarize this travel without calculating exact distances or travel times, or the DM might have you use the travel pace rules below.

If you need to know how fast you can move when every second matters, see the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbCombat0000000.JournalEntryPage.E9fzdKGx4UxrtOG7]{movement rules} in Combat later in this chapter.
translation:
在一次冒险中，角色可能会进行长途旅行，这可能需要数小时或数天。DM可以总结这种旅行，而无需计算确切的距离或旅行时间，或者DM可能会让你使用下面的旅行步调规则。

如果每秒钟都很重要，你需要知道你可以移动得多快，请参阅本章后面战斗中的@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbCombat0000000.JournalEntryPage.E9fzdKGx4UxrtOG7]规则。

original:
Marching Order

The adventurers should establish a marching order while they travel, whether indoors or outdoors. A marching order makes it easier to determine which characters are affected by traps, which ones can spot hidden enemies, and which ones are the closest to those enemies if a fight breaks out. You can change your marching order outside combat and record the order any way you like: write it down, for example, or arrange miniatures to show it.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbAppendixDRule.JournalEntryPage.eFAISahBloR2X8MX inline]
translation:
行进队列

冒险者在旅行时，无论是室内还是室外，都应该建立一个行进队列。行进队列可以更容易地确定哪些角色受到陷阱的影响，哪些人能够发现躲藏的敌人，以及如果战斗爆发时哪些人最接近这些敌人。你可以在战斗外改变你的行进队列，并以你喜欢的任何方式记录顺序：例如，写下来或安排微缩模型来显示它。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbAppendixDRule.JournalEntryPage.eFAISahBloR2X8MX inline]

original: Travelers in wagons, carriages, or other land vehicles choose a pace as normal. Characters in a waterborne vessel are limited to the speed of the vessel, and they don’t choose a travel pace. Depending on the vessel and the size of the crew, ships might be able to travel for up to 24 hours per day. @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbMountsAndVehi.JournalEntryPage.NVPIUDJEdFDaErTg]{Chapter 6} includes vehicles for sale.
translation: 乘坐货车、马车或其他陆地交通工具的旅行者以常速步调旅行。乘坐水运船舶旅行的角色将受限于船只的速度，并且无法选择旅行步调。取决于船只及船员的规模，船只可能每天能航行24小时。@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbMountsAndVehi.JournalEntryPage.NVPIUDJEdFDaErTg]{第 6 章} 包含了能出售的交通工具。

original:
This scene finds the player characters investigating a mysterious and potentially dangerous location. They’re moving through the environment and interacting with things they find there.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbCh1ArtHandout.JournalEntryPage.bKEMjE49kEM8ej5Z caption=false cite=false]

The characters are exploring Castle Ravenloft, and the DM describes the room the characters have entered.

Jared (as DM): A blazing hearth fire fills this room with warm light. Firelight glints off a poker beside the fireplace, and the walls are lined with ancient books. A huge painting hangs above the mantelpiece in a gilded frame. The firelight illuminates the portrait—an exact likeness of Ireena Kolyana.

Phillip (as Gareth): How old does the painting look?

Maeve (as Mirabella): I’m going to check the books!

Jared: OK, I’ll get to those in a second. Russell and Amy, what are your characters doing?

Russell (as Shreeve): I stand near the door, sword drawn, ready for danger. This place is creepy!

Amy (as Auro): I go near the fireplace. A warm fire sounds nice. But I’m also alert for danger.

3

Jared: Got it. OK, Phillip, please make an Intelligence (History) check as Gareth looks at the painting.

Phillip: I don’t have proficiency in History, but here goes. I got—oh! A 20! For a total of … 20.

Jared: Two things leap out at Gareth about the painting. First, the woman’s clothes look old-fashioned. Second, the paint is flaking in places, and the whole thing is covered by a thin layer of soot. You’d say this painting is a few centuries old.

Phillip: So maybe an ancestor of Ireena’s? Unless she’s already a vampire and this “bitten by Strahd” thing is a ruse.

Jared: Who knows? Now, Mirabella’s looking at the books?

Maeve: Yeah, I pull one off the shelf at random.

Jared: It’s a book written in Common called On the Habitations of the Divine in the Celestial and Infernal Realms.

Russell: Did you just make that up?

Jared: I’ll never tell. As you flip through the book, you notice it’s very academic, almost impenetrable.

Maeve: OK, I put that one back and pull out another.

Jared: Are Shreeve and Auro doing anything else?

4

Amy: I grab the poker and poke at logs in the fire.

Jared: As soon as you lift the poker, you hear a grinding sound, and the back of the fireplace slides to the side, revealing a room behind it!

Amy: “Uh, folks? I found something!” Can I see anything in the room beyond?

Jared: Past the flames and smoke, you see a glimmering pile of coins heaped near a chest.

5

Amy: Anybody have a quick way to put out a fire?

Phillip: And you laughed at me for preparing Create or Destroy Water! I clutch my Holy Symbol and cast the spell, drenching the fireplace.

Jared: What does the spell’s description say?

Phillip: It causes 10 gallons of water to rain down in a 30-foot Cube, extinguishing flames there.

6

Jared: Great! That puts out the fire. Without the light from the hearth, you’re back to the magic glow of Shreeve’s sword, which casts your shadows into the room beyond. But you can see, through clouds of lingering smoke, a closed chest on the floor, surrounded by piles of coins. There are two torch sconces on the far wall—one holding an unlit torch with an intricate metal base, the other empty. A skeleton in broken plate armor is lying against that wall, with one hand at its throat and the other holding the matching torch from the empty sconce.

Amy: I check out the chest!

Jared: And the rest of you?

Phillip: Gareth enters and looks at the skeleton.

Maeve: I keep watch on this side of the fireplace.

Russell: I’m still back by the first door.

Jared: Amy, the chest seems expertly made, with elegant fittings and clawed feet.

7

Amy: I try to open it. Is it locked?

Jared: It’s not locked and opens easily—and it releases a cloud of sweet-smelling gas.

Amy: Oh, no.

Jared: Oh, yes. I need Auro and Gareth to make Constitution saving throws.

Amy: Sorry, Phillip! I got an 8.

Phillip: And a 5 for Gareth.

Jared: As you draw this gas into your lungs, you feel a chill grip you, and your bodies stiffen. You both have the Paralyzed condition!

Everyone Is Accounted For. Exploration is open-ended; the players don’t take turns moving around the dungeon the way they do in combat. But the DM frequently checks in to make sure it’s clear where everyone is and what they’re doing.

Teamwork Matters. The player characters are working toward a common goal. They move together through the dungeon and cooperate to overcome its challenges. When the characters enter the room, they explore different parts of the room. When Auro finds a secret door behind the fireplace later in the example, they come together again to examine it, and Gareth figures out how to bypass the fire. It might seem like Russell’s character wasn’t doing much, but Shreeve was protecting the group by guarding the door.

Worth Rolling with or without Proficiency. You usually have a chance of success on an ability check even if you don’t have proficiency in a relevant skill. In the example, Phillip gets a 20 without proficiency. The d20 brings many surprises to the game—surprises that the DM then interprets. 3

Finding Hidden Objects. Adventure environments are full of secrets: traps, concealed doors, loose floorboards, and hidden treasures. Characters often use Wisdom checks to find things—see the Search action in the rules glossary—but sometimes they stumble on them accidentally, as Auro did here. 4

Casting Spells. Many characters have the ability to cast spells, which have a huge variety of effects. Some spells are mostly useful in combat, by dealing damage or imposing conditions. Other spells have utility in exploration. If you’re playing a spellcaster, look for a mix of combat-effective and utilitarian spells to help deal with varied challenges. 5

Know Your Spells! Have your Player’s Handbook open to the description of a spell before you cast it. Don’t expect the DM to know how your spell works, and be ready to answer any questions about it.

Vision and Light. The DM determines what the adventurers can perceive, which means being aware of light sources—like the leaping flames in the fireplace and Shreeve’s glowing sword—as well as obscuring factors like smoke and fog. See “Vision and Light” earlier in this chapter for more information. 6

Saving Throws. A saving throw is used to see whether a creature avoids or resists something. When the chest releases toxic gas, Phillip’s and Amy’s characters make Constitution saving throws. Constitution is one of the six abilities that measure creatures’ capabilities, and it has to do with health and stamina. When they fail their saves, the gas causes them to have the Paralyzed condition. See “Conditions” later in this chapter for more information. 7
translation:
在这个场景中，玩家角色将调查一个神秘而又充满潜在危险的地点。他们在环境中移动，并与他们在那里发现的事物互动。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbCh1ArtHandout.JournalEntryPage.bKEMjE49kEM8ej5Z caption=false cite=false]

角色正在探索鸦阁城堡，而DM描述了角色进入的房间。

杰瑞德（饰 DM）： 熊熊燃烧的炉火让这个房间充满温暖的光线。壁炉旁的火钳闪烁着火光，墙上挂满了古书。壁炉上方悬挂着一幅巨大的油画， 画框镀金。火光照亮了这幅肖像画--与 伊丽娜·考利安娜 一模一样。

菲利普（饰 米拉贝拉）： 这幅画看起来有多古老？

梅芙（饰 米拉贝拉）： 我要去翻看书籍！

杰瑞德：好的，我们马上就会讲到的。拉赛尔和 谢里夫，你们的角色要做什么？

拉赛尔（饰 谢里夫）： 我站在门边，拔出剑，随时准备应对危险。这地方真让人毛骨悚然！

谢里夫（饰 奥罗）： 我去壁炉旁看看。温暖的炉火看起来不错。但我也要警惕危险。

3

杰瑞德：找到了。好了，菲利普，请在米拉贝拉查看画像时进行一次智力（历史）检定。

菲利普：虽然我没有历史熟练项，但可以试试。我获得了—哇哦！20点！总共……20.

杰瑞德：关于这幅画，有两点让 米拉贝拉 印象深刻。首先，这位女士的衣服看起来很老气。其次，有些地方的涂料已经剥落，整个画像被一层薄薄的灰覆盖。可以说，这幅画已经有几个世纪的历史了。

菲利普：所以画像中的人也许是伊丽娜的祖先？除非她已经是吸血鬼了，而“被施特拉德咬伤 ”只是一个诡计。

杰瑞德：谁知道呢？米拉贝拉 现在在查看书吗？

梅芙：是的，我从书架上随意抽出一本。

杰瑞德：这是一本用通用语言写的书，名叫《论天界和地狱中神灵的居所》。

拉赛尔：你是瞎编的吗?

杰瑞德：我编不出来。当你翻阅这本书时，你会发现它非常学术化，几乎难以理解。

梅芙：好吧，我把这本书放回去，再拿出另一本书。

杰瑞德：谢里夫和奥罗在做其他事情吗？

4

谢里夫：我拿起火钳，戳着火堆里的木头。

杰瑞德：你一举起火钳，就会听到 “磨 ”的一声，壁炉的背面就会滑到一边，露出后面的房间！

谢里夫："伙计们，我发现了一些东西！”我能看到外面房间里的东西吗？

杰瑞德：穿过火焰和浓烟，你看到一个箱子旁堆着一堆闪闪发光的硬币。

5

谢里夫：谁有快速灭火的方法？

菲利普：你还嘲笑我准备了“造水枯水术”！我紧握圣徽，施展法术，将壁炉浇湿。

杰瑞德：法术的咒语是怎么说的？

菲利普：它能让10加仑的水倾泻到30尺的立方体中，扑灭那里的火焰。

6

杰瑞德：非常棒！它能把火扑灭。没有了壁炉的光亮，你又回到了谢里夫之剑的魔法光芒中，它将你的影子投射到房间之外。但透过缭绕的烟云，你可以看到地板上有一个封闭的箱子，周围堆满了硬币。远处的墙壁上有两个火炬台座——一个台座有着复杂的金属底座，上插着放着没点燃的火炬，另一个则是空的。一具身着破烂板甲的骷髅靠墙躺着，一只手扼住自己的喉咙，另一只手拿着空台座上配套的火把。

谢里夫：我去看看箱子！

杰瑞德：你们其他人呢？

菲利普：米拉贝拉 走进来，看着骷髅。

梅芙：我在壁炉这边放哨。

拉赛尔：我还在第一道门后面。

杰瑞德：谢里夫，这个箱子看起来做工精良，有优雅的配件和爪脚。

7

谢里夫：我试试打开它。它是上锁的吗？

杰瑞德：它没有上锁，很容易就能打开——而且会释放出一团散发着甜味的气体。

谢里夫：不是的，是上锁的。

杰瑞德：没有上锁。我需要奥罗和米拉贝拉进行体质豁免检定。

谢里夫：抱歉，菲利普！我获得了8。

菲利普：米拉贝拉 获得了5。

杰瑞德：当你把这种气体吸入肺部时，你会感到一阵寒意袭来，身体变得僵硬。你们陷入麻痹状态！

责任是均等的。 探索是开放式的；玩家不会像战斗那样轮流在地城中移动。但DM需要经常确认每个人都清楚自己在哪儿、在做什么。

团队合作很重要。 玩家角色都在为一个共同的目标而努力。他们一起穿越地城，合作克服挑战。角色进入房间后，会探索房间的不同部分。后来，奥罗在壁炉后面发现了一扇暗门，他们又一起研究了一下，米拉贝拉想出了绕过壁炉的办法。看起来 拉赛尔 的角色似乎没做什么，但谢里夫却在守门，保护着大家。

无论是否有“熟练项”，都值得一试。 即使没有相关技能的“熟练项”，你通常也有机会通过属性检定。在这个示例中，菲利普在没有熟练项的情况下获得了20分。d20给游戏带来了许多惊喜——这些惊喜将由DM来解释。 3

寻找隐藏的物件。 冒险环境中充满了秘密：陷阱、暗门、松动的地板和躲藏的宝藏。角色通常会使用感知检定来寻找物品——参见规则术语表中的“搜索 ”动作——但有时他们也会意外地发现这些物品，就像奥罗在这里所做的那样。 4

施展法术。 许多角色都能施展法术，而法术的效果多种多样。有些法术主要在战斗中发挥作用，可以造成伤害或施加状态。其他法术在探险中也很有用。如果你扮演的是一名施法者，那么就需要混合使用具有战斗力和实用性的法术，以帮助应对各种挑战。.5

了解你的法术！ 在施法前，打开《玩家手册》查看法术说明。不要指望DM知道“你的法术”是如何起作用的，并准备好回答有关它的任何问题。

视觉与光照。 DM决定冒险者能感知到什么，这就意味着要注意光源——比如壁炉中跳跃的火焰和谢里夫发光的剑——以及烟雾等遮蔽因素。更多信息，请参阅本章前面的“视觉与光照”。 6

豁免检定。 豁免检定是用来判断生物是否能躲避或抵抗某种事物。当箱子释放有毒气体时，菲利普和 谢里夫的角色需要进行体质豁免检定。体质是衡量生物能力的六种属性之一，与健康和耐力有关。当他们的豁免失败时，气体就会使他们陷入麻痹状态。更多信息，请参阅本章后面的“状态”。 7

original:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbCh5ArtHandout.JournalEntryPage.96DRf9EI0dfXWdGi caption=false]

This chapter offers a collection of feats, which are special features not tied to a character class. A feat represents a talent or an area of expertise that gives a character special capabilities. It embodies training, experience, and abilities beyond what a class provides.

The sections below explain the parts of a feat and list a variety of feat options separated into categories.

Your background gives you a feat, and at certain levels, your class gives you the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.feats.Item.phbftAbilityScor]{Ability Score Improvement} feat or the choice of another feat for which you qualify.

By whatever means you acquire a feat, you can take it only once unless its description says otherwise.
translation:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbCh5ArtHandout.JournalEntryPage.96DRf9EI0dfXWdGi caption=false]

本章收录了一系列不依赖于角色职业的特性。专长代表了某一天赋或专业领域赋予角色的特殊能力。它体现了角色在职业范畴外得到的训练、经验和能力。

下面的章节解释了专长的各个部分，并按类别列出了各种专长选项。

你的背景会给予你一项专长，而当你的职业到了特定等级也会给予你 @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.feats.Item.phbftAbilityScor]专长或是选择另一个符合条件的专长。

无论以何种方式获得，除非描述另有说明，否则每项专长你只能获得一次。

original:
This chapter’s feats are organized by category—Origin, General, Fighting Style, or Epic Boon—and alphabetized in each category. All the feats are listed alphabetically in the Feat List table. If a feat can be taken more than once, an asterisk appears after its name in that table.

Parts of a Feat

The description of a feat contains the following parts, which are presented after the feat’s name.

Category. A feat is a member of a category, which is noted in the feat. If you’re instructed to choose a feat from a specific category, such as the Origin category, that category must appear under the feat’s name. If you’re instructed to choose a feat and no category is specified, you can choose from any category.

Prerequisite. To take a feat, you must meet any prerequisite in its description unless a feature allows you to take the feat without the prerequisite. If a prerequisite includes a class, you must have at least 1 level in that class to take the feat.

Benefit. The benefits of a feat are detailed after any prerequisites are listed. If you have a feat, you gain its benefits.

Repeatable. A feat can be taken only once unless its description states otherwise in a “Repeatable” subsection.

translation:
本章的专长按类别编排，分别为 起源、通用、战斗风格 和 传奇恩惠，并在每个类别中按字母顺序排列。所有专长都按字母顺序排列在“专长”表中。表格中会用星号在名称后标记那些允许被多次选取的专长。

专长的组成

专长描述包含以下部分，在专长名称之后显示。

类别。 每个专长都属于某一被标注的类别。如果你被指引从特定类别中选择专长，比如 起源 类别，那么对应的类别必须出现在所选专长名称的下方。如果指示未提及你选择专长的类别，那么你可以从所有类别中选择。

先决条件。 除非某个特性允许你在无视先决条件的情况下选择某项专长，否则你必须满足其描述中的所有先决条件才能选择这项专长。如果先决条件中包含职业，则你至少要达到该职业的 1 级才能选择该专长。

增益。 专长的增益会在先决条件后详细描述。如果你拥有一项专长，你就会获得它的增益。

复选。 除非注明了“复选”，否则一项专长只能选取一次。

These feats are in the Origin category.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbCh5ArtHandout.JournalEntryPage.8yatXrf4jcj1NnLA caption=false]

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.feats.Item.phbftAlert000000]{Alert}

Origin Feat

You gain the following benefits.

Initiative Proficiency. When you roll Initiative, you can add your Proficiency Bonus to the roll.

Initiative Swap. Immediately after you roll Initiative, you can swap your Initiative with the Initiative of one willing ally in the same combat. You can’t make this swap if you or the ally has the Incapacitated condition.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.feats.Item.phbftCrafter0000]{Crafter}

Origin Feat

You gain the following benefits.

Tool Proficiency. You gain proficiency with three different Artisan’s Tools of your choice from the Fast Crafting table.

Discount. Whenever you buy a nonmagical item, you receive a 20 percent discount on it.

Fast Crafting. When you finish a Long Rest, you can craft one piece of gear from the Fast Crafting table, provided you have the Artisan’s Tools associated with that item and have proficiency with those tools. The item lasts until you finish another Long Rest, at which point the item falls apart.

Fast Crafting

Artisan’s Tools

Crafted Gear

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.feats.Item.phbftHealer00000]{Healer}

Origin Feat

You gain the following benefits.

Battle Medic. If you have a Healer’s Kit, you can expend one use of it and tend to a creature within 5 feet of yourself as a Utilize action. That creature can expend one of its Hit Point Dice, and you then roll that die. The creature regains a number of Hit Points equal to the roll plus your Proficiency Bonus.

Healing Rerolls. Whenever you roll a die to determine the number of Hit Points you restore with a spell or with this feat’s Battle Medic benefit, you can reroll the die if it rolls a 1, and you must use the new roll.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.feats.Item.phbftLucky000000]{Lucky}

Origin Feat

You gain the following benefits.

Luck Points. You have a number of Luck Points equal to your Proficiency Bonus and can spend the points on the benefits below. You regain your expended Luck Points when you finish a Long Rest.

Advantage. When you roll a d20 for a D20 Test, you can spend 1 Luck Point to give yourself Advantage on the roll.

Disadvantage. When a creature rolls a d20 for an attack roll against you, you can spend 1 Luck Point to impose Disadvantage on that roll.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.feats.Item.phbftMagicInitia]{Magic Initiate}

Origin Feat

You gain the following benefits.

Two Cantrips. You learn two cantrips of your choice from the Cleric, Druid, or Wizard spell list. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this feat’s spells (choose when you select this feat).

Level 1 Spell. Choose a level 1 spell from the same list you selected for this feat’s cantrips. You always have that spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a Long Rest. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have.

Spell Change. Whenever you gain a new level, you can replace one of the spells you chose for this feat with a different spell of the same level from the chosen spell list.

Repeatable. You can take this feat more than once, but you must choose a different spell list each time.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.feats.Item.phbftMusician000]{Musician}

Origin Feat

You gain the following benefits.

Instrument Training. You gain proficiency with three Musical Instruments of your choice.

Encouraging Song. As you finish a Short or Long Rest, you can play a song on a Musical Instrument with which you have proficiency and give Heroic Inspiration to allies who hear the song. The number of allies you can affect in this way equals your Proficiency Bonus.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.feats.Item.phbftSavageAttac]{Savage Attacker}

Origin Feat

You’ve trained to deal particularly damaging strikes. Once per turn when you hit a target with a weapon, you can roll the weapon’s damage dice twice and use either roll against the target.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.feats.Item.phbftSkilled0000]{Skilled}

Origin Feat

You gain proficiency in any combination of three skills or tools of your choice.

Repeatable. You can take this feat more than once.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.feats.Item.phbftTavernBrawl]{Tavern Brawler}

Origin Feat

You gain the following benefits.

Enhanced Unarmed Strike. When you hit with your Unarmed Strike and deal damage, you can deal Bludgeoning damage equal to 1d4 plus your Strength modifier instead of the normal damage of an Unarmed Strike.

Damage Rerolls. Whenever you roll a damage die for your Unarmed Strike, you can reroll the die if it rolls a 1, and you must use the new roll.

Improvised Weaponry. You have proficiency with improvised weapons.

Push. When you hit a creature with an Unarmed Strike as part of the Attack action on your turn, you can deal damage to the target and also push it 5 feet away from you. You can use this benefit only once per turn.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.feats.Item.phbftTough000000]{Tough}

Origin Feat

Your Hit Point maximum increases by an amount equal to twice your character level when you gain this feat. Whenever you gain a character level thereafter, your Hit Point maximum increases by an additional 2 Hit Points.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbCh5ArtHandout.JournalEntryPage.YPKbGXWVge8Sm18K caption=false]
translation:
这些专长属于起源类别。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.content.JournalEntry.phbCh5ArtHandout.JournalEntryPage.8yatXrf4jcj1NnLA caption=false]

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.feats.Item.phbftAlert000000]

起源专长

你将获得以下增益。

先攻熟练。 掷先攻时，你可以将你的熟练加值加到结果上。

先攻交换。 掷出先攻后，你可以立即将自己的 先攻与同场战斗中一位自愿盟友的先攻进行交换。如果自己或盟友处于 &Reference[Incapacitated] 状态，则不能进行此交换。

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.feats.Item.phbftCrafter0000]

起源专长

你将获得以下增益。

工具熟练。 你可以从快速制作表中选择三种不同的工匠工具获得熟练项。

折扣。 你无论何时购买非魔法物品，都能获得 20% 的折扣。

快速制作。 完成长休后，你可以从快速制作表中制作一件装备，前提是你拥有与该装备相关的工匠工具与对应的工具熟练项。该物品会一直持续到你完成下一次长休，随后便会破碎损毁。

快速制作

工匠工具

工艺装备
